{"type":"row","data":{"table":"postmeta","row":{"meta_id":"366","post_id":"139","meta_key":"_edit_last","meta_value":"1"}}}
{"type":"row","data":{"table":"postmeta","row":{"meta_id":"367","post_id":"139","meta_key":"_edit_lock","meta_value":"1520536623:1"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"postmeta","row":{"meta_id":"369","post_id":"140","meta_key":"fw_options","meta_value":"a:0:{}"}}}
{"type":"row","data":{"table":"postmeta","row":{"meta_id":"370","post_id":"139","meta_key":"fw:opt:ext:pb:page-builder:json","meta_value":"[{\"type\":\"section\",\"atts\":{\"is_fullwidth\":false,\"background_color\":\"\",\"background_image\":\"\",\"video\":\"\",\"custom_class\":\"\"},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"column\",\"width\":\"1_1\",\"atts\":{\"custom_class\":\"\",\"anchor\":\"\",\"slide\":false},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"text_block\",\"atts\":{\"text\":\"<p>Have you ever \\ufb01nally just gave in to the temptation and read your horoscope in the newspaper on Sunday morning? Sure, we all have. For most of us, it\\u2019s a curiosity, an amusement to see what they say our day will be like based on the sign of the zodiac that we were born under. Sometimes we forget that this little diversion is actually part of an ancient science called astrology that has had a powerful e\\ufb00ect on many cultures dating back to centuries before Christ.<\\\/p><p>That is not to say that astrology is a dead art today. It is easy to \\ufb01nd astrology advocates in every town, advertising in the newspaper and on television trying to convince us that they can tell our fortune, our future and help cure our ills by exploring the mysteries of astrology.<\\\/p><p><img class=\\\"size-full wp-image-182 aligncenter\\\" src=\\\"http:\\\/\\\/unyson\\\/wp-content\\\/uploads\\\/2018\\\/02\\\/forest.jpg\\\" alt=\\\"\\\" width=\\\"900\\\" height=\\\"443\\\" \\\/><\\\/p><h2>Civilisation<\\\/h2><p>When you are a lover of astronomy, the confusion between astronomy and astrology by those who don\\u2019t really understand the di\\ufb00erences can get pretty aggravating. And in early civilizations, the two disciplines were not separate. Astrology was just the religious side of the science of astronomy. So what changed?<\\\/p>\"}}]}]},{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"media_image\",\"atts\":{\"image\":{\"attachment_id\":\"200\",\"url\":\"\\\/\\\/unyson\\\/wp-content\\\/uploads\\\/2018\\\/02\\\/map.jpg\"},\"width\":\"\",\"height\":\"\",\"is_fullscreen\":true,\"link\":\"\",\"target\":\"_self\"}},{\"type\":\"section\",\"atts\":{\"is_fullwidth\":false,\"background_color\":\"\",\"background_image\":\"\",\"video\":\"\",\"custom_class\":\"\"},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"column\",\"width\":\"1_1\",\"atts\":{\"custom_class\":\"\",\"anchor\":\"\",\"slide\":false},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"text_block\",\"atts\":{\"text\":\"<p>The most signi\\ufb01cant shift that set in motion the separation of the two lines of thought began in the \\ufb01rst century when Ptolemy wrote the very \\ufb01rst book on astronomy called the Tetrabiblos. In it, he began to suggest that astronomy should be considered a separate science from astrology. It was quite a revolutionary book because it also was the \\ufb01rst scienti\\ufb01c document to suggest that the earth was not the center of the universe and that astronomy should be focused strictly on the observation and recording of events in the cosmos.<\\\/p><p><img class=\\\"alignleft size-full wp-image-194\\\" src=\\\"http:\\\/\\\/unyson\\\/wp-content\\\/uploads\\\/2018\\\/02\\\/forest-small.jpg\\\" alt=\\\"\\\" width=\\\"580\\\" height=\\\"434\\\" \\\/><\\\/p><p>&nbsp;<\\\/p><p><strong><em>Over the next 2000 years, we have come a long way. <\\\/em><\\\/strong><\\\/p><p><em><strong>Not only has science and religion completely gone their separate ways <\\\/strong><\\\/em><\\\/p><p>&nbsp;<\\\/p><p>Over the next 2000 years, we have come a long way. Not only has science and religion completely gone their separate ways since Ptolemy but the science of astronomy makes tremendous strides every year that are so phenomenal, Ptolemy would be truly astounded.<\\\/p><p>Probably the biggest point of diversion between a student of astrology and astronomy is the belief that the position of the stars has meaning over the events on our lives. Of course, we do know that the weather and tides and other important aspects of our lives are a\\ufb00ected by the stars, planets and heavenly bodies, particularly the moon. But these things are happening because of completely explainable scienti\\ufb01c laws in motion, not because of mystical forces at work.<\\\/p><p>[Best_Wordpress_Gallery id=\\\"2\\\" gal_title=\\\"Demo gallery\\\"]<\\\/p><h2>Biggest point<\\\/h2><p>Probably the biggest point of diversion between a student of astrology and astronomy is the belief that the position of the stars has meaning over the events on our lives. Of course, we do know that the weather and tides and other important aspects of our lives are a\\ufb00ected by the stars, planets and heavenly bodies, particularly the moon. But these things are happening because of completely explainable scienti\\ufb01c laws in motion, not because of mystical forces at work.<\\\/p><p>What can we, as devotees of astronomy conclude about the close relationship between astrology and astronomy? Well, for sure we want to be able to explain to anyone who is confused by the similarity in the words what the di\\ufb00erences are. We do not want to see the two approaches to the stars and planets to become confused again. But we should do all we can do keep that distinction clear without becoming skeptical or demeaning towards those who may still hold to the teachings of astrology.<\\\/p><p>It is important to remember that what is part of a person\\u2019s religious life has a level of sacred belief to the one holding it. And it is not respectful to sco\\ufb00 at such things. If for no other reason than out of respect for the ancient origins of astronomy, we should give courtesy who still are exploring whether astrology has any validity for them.<\\\/p>\"}}]}]}]"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"postmeta","row":{"meta_id":"382","post_id":"142","meta_key":"fw_options","meta_value":"a:1:{s:12:\"page-builder\";a:2:{s:4:\"json\";s:2:\"[]\";s:14:\"builder_active\";b:0;}}"}}}
{"type":"row","data":{"table":"postmeta","row":{"meta_id":"383","post_id":"143","meta_key":"fw:opt:ext:pb:page-builder:json","meta_value":"[{\"type\":\"section\",\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"column\",\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"text_block\",\"atts\":{\"text\":\"<h1>Heading 1<\\\/h1><p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\\\/p><h2>Heading 2<\\\/h2><p>Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. They can be exchanged for other currencies, products, and services. As of February 2015, over 100,000 merchants and vendors accepted bitcoin as payment. Research produced by the University of Cambridge estimates that in 2017, there are 2.9 to 5.8 million unique users using a cryptocurrency wallet, most of them using bitcoin.<\\\/p><h3>Heading 3<\\\/h3><p>The word bitcoin first occurred and was defined in the white paper that was published on 31 October 2008. It is a compound of the words bit and coin. The white paper frequently uses the shorter coin. There is no uniform convention for bitcoin capitalization. Some sources use Bitcoin, capitalized, to refer to the technology and network and bitcoin, lowercase, to refer to the unit of account. The Wall Street Journal, The Chronicle of Higher Education, and the Oxford English Dictionary advocate use of lowercase bitcoin in all cases, a convention followed throughout this article.<\\\/p><h4>Heading 4<\\\/h4><p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \\u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\\\/p><h5>Heading 5<\\\/h5><p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \\\"bitcoin.org\\\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\\\/p><h6>Heading 6<\\\/h6><p>In January 2009, the bitcoin network came into existence after Satoshi Nakamoto mined the first ever block on the chain, known as the genesis block. Embedded in the coinbase of this block was the following text:<\\\/p>\"}}],\"width\":\"1_1\",\"atts\":{\"custom_class\":\"\",\"anchor\":\"\",\"slide\":false}}],\"atts\":{\"is_fullwidth\":false,\"background_color\":\"\",\"background_image\":\"\",\"video\":\"\",\"custom_class\":\"\"}}]"}}}

1<\\\/h1><h2>Heading 2<\\\/h2><h3>Heading 3<\\\/h3><p>The word bitcoin first occurred and was defined in the white paper that was published on 31 October 2008. It is a compound of the words bit and coin. The white paper frequently uses the shorter coin. There is no uniform convention for bitcoin capitalization. Some sources use Bitcoin, capitalized, to refer to the technology and network and bitcoin, lowercase, to refer to the unit of account. The Wall Street Journal, The Chronicle of Higher Education, and the Oxford English Dictionary advocate use of lowercase bitcoin in all cases, a convention followed throughout this article.<\\\/p><h4>Heading 4<\\\/h4><p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \\u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\\\/p><h5>Heading 5<\\\/h5><p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \\\"bitcoin.org\\\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\\\/p><h6>Heading 6<\\\/h6><p>In January 2009, the bitcoin network came into existence after Satoshi Nakamoto mined the first ever block on the chain, known as the genesis block. Embedded in the coinbase of this block was the following text:<\\\/p><h2>Unordered Lists<\\\/h2><ul><li>List item one<ul><li>List item one<ul><li>List item one<\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><h3>Ordered List<\\\/h3><ol><li>List item one -start at 8<ol><li>List item one<ol reversed=\\\"reversed\\\"><li>List item one -reversed attribute<\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><blockquote><p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\\\/p><\\\/blockquote>\"}}]}]}]"}}}

It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.\"},{\"tab_title\":\"Tab 2\",\"tab_content\":\"Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. They can be exchanged for other currencies, products, and services. As of February 2015, over 100,000 merchants and vendors accepted bitcoin as payment. Research produced by the University of Cambridge estimates that in 2017, there are 2.9 to 5.8 million unique users using a cryptocurrency wallet, most of them using bitcoin.\"}]}}]}]"}}}

The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.\"},{\"tab_title\":\"Tab 2\",\"tab_content\":\"Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. bitcoin.\"}]}}]},{\"type\":\"column\",\"width\":\"1_1\",\"atts\":{\"custom_class\":\"\",\"anchor\":\"\",\"slide\":false},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"text_block\",\"atts\":{\"text\":\"<h3>Calendar<\\\/h3>\"}},{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"calendar\",\"atts\":{\"data_provider\":{\"population_method\":\"custom\",\"custom\":{\"custom_events\":[{\"title\":\"New 1\",\"tab_content\":\"The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \\u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.\"},{\"tab_title\":\"Tab 2\",\"tab_content\":\"On 18 August 2008, the domain name \\\"bitcoin.org\\\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.\"}]}}]},{\"type\":\"column\",\"width\":\"1_1\",\"atts\":{\"custom_class\":\"\",\"anchor\":\"\",\"slide\":false},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"text_block\",\"atts\":{\"text\":\"<h3>Table<\\\/h3>\"}},{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"table\",\"atts\":{\"table\":{\"rows\":[{\"name\":\"heading-row\"},{\"name\":\"default-row\"},{\"name\":\"default-row\"},{\"name\":\"default-row\"}],\"cols\":[{\"name\":\"default-col\"},{\"name\":\"default-col\"},{\"name\":\"default-col\"},{\"name\":\"default-col\"}],\"header_options\":{\"table_purpose\":\"pricing\"},\"content\":[[{\"textarea\":\"\"},{\"textarea\":\"Table header 1\"},{\"textarea\":\"Table header 2\"},{\"textarea\":\"Table header 3\"}],[{\"textarea\":\"Table row 1\"},{\"textarea\":\"Data\"},{\"textarea\":\"Data\"},{\"textarea\":\"Data\"}],[{\"textarea\":\"Table row 2\"},{\"textarea\":\"Data\"},{\"textarea\":\"Data\"},{\"textarea\":\"Data\"}],[{\"textarea\":\"Table row 3\"},{\"textarea\":\"Data\"},{\"textarea\":\"Data\"},{\"textarea\":\"Data\"}]]}}}]},{\"type\":\"column\",\"width\":\"1_1\",\"atts\":{\"custom_class\":\"\",\"anchor\":\"\",\"slide\":false},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"text_block\",\"atts\":{\"text\":\"<h3>Notification<\\\/h3>\"}},{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"notification\",\"atts\":{\"message\":\"Congratulations\",\"type\":\"success\"}},{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"notification\",\"atts\":{\"message\":\"Information\",\"type\":\"info\"}},{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"notification\",\"atts\":{\"message\":\"Warning\",\"type\":\"warning\"}},{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"notification\",\"atts\":{\"message\":\"Error\",\"type\":\"danger\"}}]}]"}}}

It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.\"},{\"tab_title\":\"Tab 2\",\"tab_content\":\"Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. 1\",\"tab_content\":\"The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \\u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.\"},{\"tab_title\":\"Tab 2\",\"tab_content\":\"On 18 August 2008, the domain name \\\"bitcoin.org\\\" was registered. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.\"}]}}]},{\"type\":\"column\",\"width\":\"1_1\",\"atts\":{\"custom_class\":\"\",\"anchor\":\"\",\"slide\":false},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"text_block\",\"atts\":{\"text\":\"<h3>Table<\\\/h3>\"}},{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"table\",\"atts\":{\"table\":{\"rows\":[{\"name\":\"heading-row\"},{\"name\":\"default-row\"},{\"name\":\"default-row\"},{\"name\":\"default-row\"}],\"cols\":[{\"name\":\"default-col\"},{\"name\":\"default-col\"},{\"name\":\"default-col\"},{\"name\":\"default-col\"}],\"header_options\":{\"table_purpose\":\"pricing\"},\"content\":[[{\"textarea\":\"\"},{\"textarea\":\"Table Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \\u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.\"},{\"tab_title\":\"Tab 2\",\"tab_content\":\"Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.\"},{\"tab_title\":\"Tab 2\",\"tab_content\":\"Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. 1\",\"tab_content\":\"The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \\u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.\"},{\"tab_title\":\"Tab 2\",\"tab_content\":\"On 18 August 2008, the domain name \\\"bitcoin.org\\\" was registered. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.\"},{\"tab_title\":\"Tab 2\",\"tab_content\":\"Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. They can be exchanged for other currencies, products, and services. As of February 2015, over 100,000 merchants and vendors accepted bitcoin as payment. Research produced by the University of Cambridge estimates that in 2017, there are 2.9 to 5.8 million unique users using a cryptocurrency wallet, most of them using bitcoin.\"}]}}]},{\"type\":\"column\",\"width\":\"1_1\",\"atts\":{\"custom_class\":\"\",\"anchor\":\"\",\"slide\":false},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"text_block\",\"atts\":{\"text\":\"<h3>Calendar<\\\/h3>\"}},{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"calendar\",\"atts\":{\"data_provider\":{\"population_method\":\"custom\",\"custom\":{\"custom_events\":[{\"title\":\"New 1\",\"tab_content\":\"The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \\u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.\"},{\"tab_title\":\"Tab 2\",\"tab_content\":\"On 18 August 2008, the domain name \\\"bitcoin.org\\\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.\"},{\"tab_title\":\"Tab 2\",\"tab_content\":\"Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. 1\",\"tab_content\":\"The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \\u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.\"},{\"tab_title\":\"Tab 2\",\"tab_content\":\"On 18 August 2008, the domain name \\\"bitcoin.org\\\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \\u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.\"},{\"tab_title\":\"Tab 2\",\"tab_content\":\"On 18 August 2008, the domain name \\\"bitcoin.org\\\" was registered. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. {"type":"row","data":{"table":"postmeta","row":{"meta_id":"445","post_id":"168","meta_key":"fw_options","meta_value":"a:1:{s:12:\"page-builder\";a:2:{s:4:\"json\";s:2:\"[]\";s:14:\"builder_active\";b:1;}}"}}}
{"type":"row","data":{"table":"postmeta","row":{"meta_id":"446","post_id":"169","meta_key":"fw:opt:ext:pb:page-builder:json","meta_value":"[{\"type\":\"section\",\"atts\":{\"is_fullwidth\":false,\"background_color\":\"\",\"background_image\":\"\",\"video\":\"\",\"custom_class\":\"\"},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"column\",\"width\":\"1_1\",\"atts\":{\"custom_class\":\"\",\"anchor\":\"\",\"slide\":false},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"text_block\",\"atts\":{\"text\":\"<h1>Heading 1<\\\/h1><p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\\\/p><h2>Heading 2<\\\/h2><p>Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. They can be exchanged for other currencies, products, and services. As of February 2015, over 100,000 merchants and vendors accepted bitcoin as payment. Research produced by the University of Cambridge estimates that in 2017, there are 2.9 to 5.8 million unique users using a cryptocurrency wallet, most of them using bitcoin.<\\\/p><h3>Heading 3<\\\/h3><p>The word bitcoin first occurred and was defined in the white paper that was published on 31 October 2008. It is a compound of the words bit and coin. The white paper frequently uses the shorter coin. There is no uniform convention for bitcoin capitalization. Some sources use Bitcoin, capitalized, to refer to the technology and network and bitcoin, lowercase, to refer to the unit of account. The Wall Street Journal, The Chronicle of Higher Education, and the Oxford English Dictionary advocate use of lowercase bitcoin in all cases, a convention followed throughout this article.<\\\/p><h4>Heading 4<\\\/h4><p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \\u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\\\/p><h5>Heading 5<\\\/h5><p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \\\"bitcoin.org\\\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\\\/p><h6>Heading 6<\\\/h6><p>In January 2009, the bitcoin network came into existence after Satoshi Nakamoto mined the first ever block on the chain, known as the genesis block. Embedded in the coinbase of this block was the following text:<\\\/p><h2>Unordered Lists<\\\/h2><ul><li>List item one<ul><li>List item one<ul><li>List item one<\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><h3>Ordered List<\\\/h3><ol><li>List item one -start at 8<ol><li>List item one<ol reversed=\\\"reversed\\\"><li>List item one -reversed attribute<\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><li><\\\/li><\\\/ol>\"}}]}]}]"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"postmeta","row":{"meta_id":"448","post_id":"170","meta_key":"fw:opt:ext:pb:page-builder:json","meta_value":"[{\"type\":\"section\",\"atts\":{\"is_fullwidth\":false,\"background_color\":\"\",\"background_image\":\"\",\"video\":\"\",\"custom_class\":\"\"},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"column\",\"width\":\"1_1\",\"atts\":{\"custom_class\":\"\",\"anchor\":\"\",\"slide\":false},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"text_block\",\"atts\":{\"text\":\"<h1>Heading 1<\\\/h1><p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\\\/p><h2>Heading 2<\\\/h2><p>Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. They can be exchanged for other currencies, products, and services. As of February 2015, over 100,000 merchants and vendors accepted bitcoin as payment. Research produced by the University of Cambridge estimates that in 2017, there are 2.9 to 5.8 million unique users using a cryptocurrency wallet, most of them using bitcoin.<\\\/p><h3>Heading 3<\\\/h3><p>The word bitcoin first occurred and was defined in the white paper that was published on 31 October 2008. It is a compound of the words bit and coin. The white paper frequently uses the shorter coin. There is no uniform convention for bitcoin capitalization. Some sources use Bitcoin, capitalized, to refer to the technology and network and bitcoin, lowercase, to refer to the unit of account. The Wall Street Journal, The Chronicle of Higher Education, and the Oxford English Dictionary advocate use of lowercase bitcoin in all cases, a convention followed throughout this article.<\\\/p><h4>Heading 4<\\\/h4><p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \\u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\\\/p><h5>Heading 5<\\\/h5><p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \\\"bitcoin.org\\\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\\\/p><h6>Heading 6<\\\/h6><p>In January 2009, the bitcoin network came into existence after Satoshi Nakamoto mined the first ever block on the chain, known as the genesis block. Embedded in the coinbase of this block was the following text:<\\\/p><h2>Unordered Lists<\\\/h2><ul><li>List item one<ul><li>List item one<ul><li>List item one<\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><h3>Ordered List<\\\/h3><ol><li>List item one -start at 8<ol><li>List item one<ol reversed=\\\"reversed\\\"><li>List item one -reversed attribute<\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol>\"}}]}]}]"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"postmeta","row":{"meta_id":"450","post_id":"171","meta_key":"fw:opt:ext:pb:page-builder:json","meta_value":"[{\"type\":\"section\",\"atts\":{\"is_fullwidth\":false,\"background_color\":\"\",\"background_image\":\"\",\"video\":\"\",\"custom_class\":\"\"},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"column\",\"width\":\"1_1\",\"atts\":{\"custom_class\":\"\",\"anchor\":\"\",\"slide\":false},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"text_block\",\"atts\":{\"text\":\"<h1>Heading 1<\\\/h1><p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\\\/p><h2>Heading 2<\\\/h2><p>Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. They can be exchanged for other currencies, products, and services. As of February 2015, over 100,000 merchants and vendors accepted bitcoin as payment. Research produced by the University of Cambridge estimates that in 2017, there are 2.9 to 5.8 million unique users using a cryptocurrency wallet, most of them using bitcoin.<\\\/p><h3>Heading 3<\\\/h3><p>The word bitcoin first occurred and was defined in the white paper that was published on 31 October 2008. It is a compound of the words bit and coin. The white paper frequently uses the shorter coin. There is no uniform convention for bitcoin capitalization. Some sources use Bitcoin, capitalized, to refer to the technology and network and bitcoin, lowercase, to refer to the unit of account. The Wall Street Journal, The Chronicle of Higher Education, and the Oxford English Dictionary advocate use of lowercase bitcoin in all cases, a convention followed throughout this article.<\\\/p><h4>Heading 4<\\\/h4><p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \\u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\\\/p><h5>Heading 5<\\\/h5><p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \\\"bitcoin.org\\\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\\\/p><h6>Heading 6<\\\/h6><p>In January 2009, the bitcoin network came into existence after Satoshi Nakamoto mined the first ever block on the chain, known as the genesis block. Embedded in the coinbase of this block was the following text:<\\\/p><h2>Unordered Lists<\\\/h2><ul><li>List item one<ul><li>List item one<ul><li>List item one<\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><h3>Ordered List<\\\/h3><ol><li>List item one -start at 8<ol><li>List item one<ol reversed=\\\"reversed\\\"><li>List item one -reversed attribute<\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><blockquote><p>Blockquote<\\\/p><\\\/blockquote>\"}}]}]}]"}}}

It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\\\/p><h2>Heading 2<\\\/h2><p>Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. The Wall Street Journal, The Chronicle of Higher Education, and the Oxford English Dictionary advocate use of lowercase bitcoin in all cases, a convention followed throughout this article.<\\\/p><h4>Heading 4<\\\/h4><p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.\"},{\"tab_title\":\"Tab 2\",\"tab_content\":\"Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. 1\",\"tab_content\":\"The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \\u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.\"},{\"tab_title\":\"Tab 2\",\"tab_content\":\"On 18 August 2008, the domain name \\\"bitcoin.org\\\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.\"},{\"tab_title\":\"Tab 2\",\"tab_content\":\"Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. 1\",\"tab_content\":\"The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \\u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.\"},{\"tab_title\":\"Tab 2\",\"tab_content\":\"On 18 August 2008, the domain name \\\"bitcoin.org\\\" was registered. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. {"type":"row","data":{"table":"postmeta","row":{"meta_id":"470","post_id":"182","meta_key":"_wp_attached_file","meta_value":"2018\/02\/forest-e1518699388205.jpg"}}}
{"type":"row","data":{"table":"postmeta","row":{"meta_id":"471","post_id":"182","meta_key":"_wp_attachment_metadata","meta_value":"a:5:{s:5:\"width\";i:600;s:6:\"height\";i:295;s:4:\"file\";s:33:\"2018\/02\/forest-e1518699388205.jpg\";s:5:\"sizes\";a:3:{s:9:\"thumbnail\";a:4:{s:4:\"file\";s:18:\"forest-150x150.jpg\";s:5:\"width\";i:150;s:6:\"height\";i:150;s:9:\"mime-type\";s:10:\"image\/jpeg\";}s:6:\"medium\";a:4:{s:4:\"file\";s:18:\"forest-300x148.jpg\";s:5:\"width\";i:300;s:6:\"height\";i:148;s:9:\"mime-type\";s:10:\"image\/jpeg\";}s:12:\"medium_large\";a:4:{s:4:\"file\";s:18:\"forest-768x378.jpg\";s:5:\"width\";i:768;s:6:\"height\";i:378;s:9:\"mime-type\";s:10:\"image\/jpeg\";}}s:10:\"image_meta\";a:12:{s:8:\"aperture\";s:1:\"0\";s:6:\"credit\";s:0:\"\";s:6:\"camera\";s:0:\"\";s:7:\"caption\";s:0:\"\";s:17:\"created_timestamp\";s:1:\"0\";s:9:\"copyright\";s:0:\"\";s:12:\"focal_length\";s:1:\"0\";s:3:\"iso\";s:1:\"0\";s:13:\"shutter_speed\";s:1:\"0\";s:5:\"title\";s:0:\"\";s:11:\"orientation\";s:1:\"0\";s:8:\"keywords\";a:0:{}}}"}}}
{"type":"row","data":{"table":"postmeta","row":{"meta_id":"472","post_id":"183","meta_key":"fw:opt:ext:pb:page-builder:json","meta_value":"[{\"type\":\"section\",\"atts\":{\"is_fullwidth\":false,\"background_color\":\"\",\"background_image\":\"\",\"video\":\"\",\"custom_class\":\"\"},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"column\",\"width\":\"1_1\",\"atts\":{\"custom_class\":\"\",\"anchor\":\"\",\"slide\":false},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"text_block\",\"atts\":{\"text\":\"<h1>Tokenomy<\\\/h1><p>Have you ever \\ufb01nally just gave in to the temptation and read your horoscope in the newspaper on Sunday morning? Sure, we all have. For most of us, it\\u2019s a curiosity, an amusement to see what they say our day will be like based on the sign of the zodiac that we were born under. Sometimes we forget that this little diversion is actually part of an ancient science called astrology that has had a powerful e\\ufb00ect on many cultures dating back to centuries before Christ.<\\\/p><p>That is not to say that astrology is a dead art today. It is easy to \\ufb01nd astrology advocates in every town, advertising in the newspaper and on television trying to convince us that they can tell our fortune, our future and help cure our ills by exploring the mysteries of astrology.<\\\/p><p><img class=\\\"alignnone size-full wp-image-182\\\" src=\\\"http:\\\/\\\/unyson\\\/wp-content\\\/uploads\\\/2018\\\/02\\\/forest.jpg\\\" alt=\\\"\\\" width=\\\"900\\\" height=\\\"443\\\" \\\/><\\\/p><h2>Civilisation<\\\/h2><p>When you are a lover of astronomy, the confusion between astronomy and astrology by those who don\\u2019t really understand the di\\ufb00erences can get pretty aggravating. And in early civilizations, the two disciplines were not separate. Astrology was just the religious side of the science of astronomy. So what changed?<\\\/p><p>&nbsp;<\\\/p><p>The most signi\\ufb01cant shift that set in motion the separation of the two lines of thought began in the \\ufb01rst century when Ptolemy wrote the very \\ufb01rst book on astronomy called the Tetrabiblos. In it, he began to suggest that astronomy should be considered a separate science from astrology. It was quite a revolutionary book because it also was the \\ufb01rst scienti\\ufb01c document to suggest that the earth was not the center of the universe and that astronomy should be focused strictly on the observation and recording of events in the cosmos.<\\\/p><p><img class=\\\"alignleft size-medium wp-image-182\\\" src=\\\"http:\\\/\\\/unyson\\\/wp-content\\\/uploads\\\/2018\\\/02\\\/forest-300x148.jpg\\\" alt=\\\"\\\" width=\\\"300\\\" height=\\\"148\\\" \\\/><\\\/p><h3><\\\/h3><p><strong>Over the next 2000 years, we have come a long way. <\\\/strong><\\\/p><p><strong>Not only has science and religion completely gone their separate ways <\\\/strong><br \\\/><strong>When<\\\/strong><\\\/p><p>Over the next 2000 years, we have come a long way. Not only has science and religion completely gone their separate ways since Ptolemy but the science of astronomy makes tremendous strides every year that are so phenomenal, Ptolemy would be truly astounded.<\\\/p><p>Probably the biggest point of diversion between a student of astrology and astronomy is the belief that the position of the stars has meaning over the events on our lives. Of course, we do know that the weather and tides and other important aspects of our lives are a\\ufb00ected by the stars, planets and heavenly bodies, particularly the moon. But these things are happening because of completely explainable scienti\\ufb01c laws in motion, not because of mystical forces at work.<\\\/p><h2>Biggest point<\\\/h2><p>Probably the biggest point of diversion between a student of astrology and astronomy is the belief that the position of the stars has meaning over the events on our lives. Of course, we do know that the weather and tides and other important aspects of our lives are a\\ufb00ected by the stars, planets and heavenly bodies, particularly the moon. But these things are happening because of completely explainable scienti\\ufb01c laws in motion, not because of mystical forces at work.<\\\/p><p>What can we, as devotees of astronomy conclude about the close relationship between astrology and astronomy? Well, for sure we want to be able to explain to anyone who is confused by the similarity in the words what the di\\ufb00erences are. We do not want to see the two approaches to the stars and planets to become confused again. But we should do all we can do keep that distinction clear without becoming skeptical or demeaning towards those who may still hold to the teachings of astrology.<\\\/p><p>It is important to remember that what is part of a person\\u2019s religious life has a level of sacred belief to the one holding it. And it is not respectful to sco\\ufb00 at such things. If for no other reason than out of respect for the ancient origins of astronomy, we should give courtesy who still are exploring whether astrology has any validity for them.<\\\/p><p>&nbsp;<\\\/p><p>&nbsp;<\\\/p><h3>Heading 3<\\\/h3><p>The word bitcoin first occurred and was defined in the white paper that was published on 31 October 2008. It is a compound of the words bit and coin. The white paper frequently uses the shorter coin. There is no uniform convention for bitcoin capitalization. Some sources use Bitcoin, capitalized, to refer to the technology and network and bitcoin, lowercase, to refer to the unit of account. The Wall Street Journal, The Chronicle of Higher Education, and the Oxford English Dictionary advocate use of lowercase bitcoin in all cases, a convention followed throughout this article.<\\\/p><h4>Heading 4<\\\/h4><p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \\u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\\\/p><h5>Heading 5<\\\/h5><p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \\\"bitcoin.org\\\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\\\/p><h6>Heading 6<\\\/h6><p>In January 2009, the bitcoin network came into existence after Satoshi Nakamoto mined the first ever block on the chain, known as the genesis block. Embedded in the coinbase of this block was the following text:<\\\/p><h2>Unordered Lists<\\\/h2><ul><li>List item one<ul><li>List item one<ul><li>List item one<\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><h3>Ordered List<\\\/h3><ol><li>List item one -start at 8<ol><li>List item one<ol reversed=\\\"reversed\\\"><li>List item one -reversed attribute<\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><blockquote><p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\\\/p><\\\/blockquote>\"}}]}]}]"}}}
{"type":"row","data":{"table":"postmeta","row":{"meta_id":"473","post_id":"183","meta_key":"fw_options","meta_value":"a:1:{s:12:\"page-builder\";a:2:{s:4:\"json\";s:2:\"[]\";s:14:\"builder_active\";b:1;}}"}}}
{"type":"row","data":{"table":"postmeta","row":{"meta_id":"474","post_id":"184","meta_key":"fw:opt:ext:pb:page-builder:json","meta_value":"[{\"type\":\"section\",\"atts\":{\"is_fullwidth\":false,\"background_color\":\"\",\"background_image\":\"\",\"video\":\"\",\"custom_class\":\"\"},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"column\",\"width\":\"1_1\",\"atts\":{\"custom_class\":\"\",\"anchor\":\"\",\"slide\":false},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"text_block\",\"atts\":{\"text\":\"<h1>Tokenomy<\\\/h1><p>Have you ever \\ufb01nally just gave in to the temptation and read your horoscope in the newspaper on Sunday morning? Sure, we all have. For most of us, it\\u2019s a curiosity, an amusement to see what they say our day will be like based on the sign of the zodiac that we were born under. Sometimes we forget that this little diversion is actually part of an ancient science called astrology that has had a powerful e\\ufb00ect on many cultures dating back to centuries before Christ.<\\\/p><p>That is not to say that astrology is a dead art today. It is easy to \\ufb01nd astrology advocates in every town, advertising in the newspaper and on television trying to convince us that they can tell our fortune, our future and help cure our ills by exploring the mysteries of astrology.<\\\/p><p><img class=\\\"size-full wp-image-182 aligncenter\\\" src=\\\"http:\\\/\\\/unyson\\\/wp-content\\\/uploads\\\/2018\\\/02\\\/forest.jpg\\\" alt=\\\"\\\" width=\\\"900\\\" height=\\\"443\\\" \\\/><\\\/p><h2>Civilisation<\\\/h2><p>When you are a lover of astronomy, the confusion between astronomy and astrology by those who don\\u2019t really understand the di\\ufb00erences can get pretty aggravating. And in early civilizations, the two disciplines were not separate. Astrology was just the religious side of the science of astronomy. So what changed?<\\\/p><p>&nbsp;<\\\/p><p>The most signi\\ufb01cant shift that set in motion the separation of the two lines of thought began in the \\ufb01rst century when Ptolemy wrote the very \\ufb01rst book on astronomy called the Tetrabiblos. In it, he began to suggest that astronomy should be considered a separate science from astrology. It was quite a revolutionary book because it also was the \\ufb01rst scienti\\ufb01c document to suggest that the earth was not the center of the universe and that astronomy should be focused strictly on the observation and recording of events in the cosmos.<\\\/p><p><img class=\\\"alignleft size-medium wp-image-182\\\" src=\\\"http:\\\/\\\/unyson\\\/wp-content\\\/uploads\\\/2018\\\/02\\\/forest-300x148.jpg\\\" alt=\\\"\\\" width=\\\"300\\\" height=\\\"148\\\" \\\/><\\\/p><h3>\\u00a0<strong>Over the next 2000 years, we have come a long way. <\\\/strong><\\\/h3><p><strong>Not only has science and religion completely gone their separate ways <\\\/strong><br \\\/><strong>When<\\\/strong><\\\/p><p>&nbsp;<\\\/p><p>Over the next 2000 years, we have come a long way. Not only has science and religion completely gone their separate ways since Ptolemy but the science of astronomy makes tremendous strides every year that are so phenomenal, Ptolemy would be truly astounded.<\\\/p><p>Probably the biggest point of diversion between a student of astrology and astronomy is the belief that the position of the stars has meaning over the events on our lives. Of course, we do know that the weather and tides and other important aspects of our lives are a\\ufb00ected by the stars, planets and heavenly bodies, particularly the moon. But these things are happening because of completely explainable scienti\\ufb01c laws in motion, not because of mystical forces at work.<\\\/p><h2>Biggest point<\\\/h2><p>Probably the biggest point of diversion between a student of astrology and astronomy is the belief that the position of the stars has meaning over the events on our lives. Of course, we do know that the weather and tides and other important aspects of our lives are a\\ufb00ected by the stars, planets and heavenly bodies, particularly the moon. But these things are happening because of completely explainable scienti\\ufb01c laws in motion, not because of mystical forces at work.<\\\/p><p>What can we, as devotees of astronomy conclude about the close relationship between astrology and astronomy? Well, for sure we want to be able to explain to anyone who is confused by the similarity in the words what the di\\ufb00erences are. We do not want to see the two approaches to the stars and planets to become confused again. But we should do all we can do keep that distinction clear without becoming skeptical or demeaning towards those who may still hold to the teachings of astrology.<\\\/p><p>It is important to remember that what is part of a person\\u2019s religious life has a level of sacred belief to the one holding it. And it is not respectful to sco\\ufb00 at such things. If for no other reason than out of respect for the ancient origins of astronomy, we should give courtesy who still are exploring whether astrology has any validity for them.<\\\/p><p>&nbsp;<\\\/p><p>&nbsp;<\\\/p><h3>Heading 3<\\\/h3><p>The word bitcoin first occurred and was defined in the white paper that was published on 31 October 2008. It is a compound of the words bit and coin. The white paper frequently uses the shorter coin. There is no uniform convention for bitcoin capitalization. Some sources use Bitcoin, capitalized, to refer to the technology and network and bitcoin, lowercase, to refer to the unit of account. The Wall Street Journal, The Chronicle of Higher Education, and the Oxford English Dictionary advocate use of lowercase bitcoin in all cases, a convention followed throughout this article.<\\\/p><h4>Heading 4<\\\/h4><p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \\u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\\\/p><h5>Heading 5<\\\/h5><p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \\\"bitcoin.org\\\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\\\/p><h6>Heading 6<\\\/h6><p>In January 2009, the bitcoin network came into existence after Satoshi Nakamoto mined the first ever block on the chain, known as the genesis block. Embedded in the coinbase of this block was the following text:<\\\/p><h2>Unordered Lists<\\\/h2><ul><li>List item one<ul><li>List item one<ul><li>List item one<\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><h3>Ordered List<\\\/h3><ol><li>List item one -start at 8<ol><li>List item one<ol reversed=\\\"reversed\\\"><li>List item one -reversed attribute<\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><blockquote><p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\\\/p><\\\/blockquote>\"}}]}]}]"}}}

buttons\\\",\\\"required\\\":true,\\\"choices\\\":[\\\"Radio 1\\\",\\\"Radio 2\\\",\\\"Radio 3\\\"],\\\"randomize\\\":false,\\\"layout\\\":\\\"one-column\\\",\\\"info\\\":\\\"\\\"}},{\\\"type\\\":\\\"checkboxes\\\",\\\"shortcode\\\":\\\"checkboxes_0553c5a\\\",\\\"width\\\":\\\"1_2\\\",\\\"options\\\":{\\\"label\\\":\\\"Checkboxes\\\",\\\"required\\\":true,\\\"choices\\\":[\\\"Checkbox 1\\\",\\\"Checkbox 2\\\",\\\"Checkbox 3\\\"],\\\"randomize\\\":false,\\\"layout\\\":\\\"one-column\\\",\\\"info\\\":\\\"\\\"}},{\\\"type\\\":\\\"textarea\\\",\\\"shortcode\\\":\\\"textarea_7530ce2\\\",\\\"width\\\":\\\"1_1\\\",\\\"options\\\":{\\\"label\\\":\\\"Message\\\",\\\"required\\\":true,\\\"placeholder\\\":\\\"\\\",\\\"default_value\\\":\\\"\\\",\\\"constraints\\\":{\\\"constraint\\\":\\\"characters\\\",\\\"characters\\\":{\\\"min\\\":\\\"0\\\",\\\"max\\\":\\\"\\\"},\\\"words\\\":{\\\"min\\\":\\\"0\\\",\\\"max\\\":\\\"\\\"}},\\\"info\\\":\\\"\\\"}}]\"},\"email_to\":\"\",\"subject_message\":\"\\u041a\\u043e\\u043d\\u0442\\u0430\\u043a\\u0442\\u043d\\u0430\\u044f \\u0444\\u043e\\u0440\\u043c\\u0430\",\"submit_button_text\":\"\\u041e\\u0442\\u043f\\u0440\\u0430\\u0432\\u0438\\u0442\\u044c\",\"success_message\":\"\\u0421\\u043e\\u043e\\u0431\\u0449\\u0435\\u043d\\u0438\\u0435 \\u043e\\u0442\\u043f\\u0440\\u0430\\u0432\\u043b\\u0435\\u043d\\u043e!\",\"failure_message\":\"\\u0427\\u0442\\u043e-\\u0442\\u043e \\u043f\\u043e\\u0448\\u043b\\u043e \\u043d\\u0435 \\u0442\\u0430\\u043a.\",\"mailer\":{\"method\":\"wpmail\",\"smtp\":{\"host\":\"\",\"username\":\"\",\"password\":\"\",\"secure\":\"no\",\"port\":\"\"},\"general\":{\"from_name\":\"\",\"from_address\":\"\"},\"test-connection\":{\"test-connection\":\"\"}}},\"_items\":[]}]},{\"type\":\"section\",\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"column\",\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"text_block\",\"atts\":{\"text\":\"<h1>Heading 1<\\\/h1><h2>Heading 2<\\\/h2><h3>Heading 3<\\\/h3><p>The word bitcoin first occurred and was defined in the white paper that was published on 31 October 2008. It is a compound of the words bit and coin. The white paper frequently uses the shorter coin. There is no uniform convention for bitcoin capitalization. Some sources use Bitcoin, capitalized, to refer to the technology and network and bitcoin, lowercase, to refer to the unit of account. The Wall Street Journal, The Chronicle of Higher Education, and the Oxford English Dictionary advocate use of lowercase bitcoin in all cases, a convention followed throughout this article.<\\\/p><h4>Heading 4<\\\/h4><p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \\u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\\\/p><h5>Heading 5<\\\/h5><p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \\\"bitcoin.org\\\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\\\/p><h6>Heading 6<\\\/h6><p>In January 2009, the bitcoin network came into existence after Satoshi Nakamoto mined the first ever block on the chain, known as the genesis block. Embedded in the coinbase of this block was the following text:<\\\/p><h2>Unordered Lists<\\\/h2><ul><li>List item one<ul><li>List item one<ul><li>List item one<\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><h3>Ordered List<\\\/h3><ol><li>List item one -start at 8<ol><li>List item one<ol reversed=\\\"reversed\\\"><li>List item one -reversed attribute<\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><blockquote><p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\\\/p><\\\/blockquote>\"}}],\"width\":\"1_1\",\"atts\":{\"custom_class\":\"\",\"anchor\":\"\",\"slide\":false}}],\"atts\":{\"is_fullwidth\":false,\"background_color\":\"\",\"background_image\":\"\",\"video\":\"\",\"custom_class\":\"\"}}]"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"postmeta","row":{"meta_id":"480","post_id":"187","meta_key":"fw:opt:ext:pb:page-builder:json","meta_value":"[{\"type\":\"section\",\"atts\":{\"is_fullwidth\":false,\"background_color\":\"\",\"background_image\":\"\",\"video\":\"\",\"custom_class\":\"\"},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"column\",\"width\":\"1_1\",\"atts\":{\"custom_class\":\"\",\"anchor\":\"\",\"slide\":false},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"text_block\",\"atts\":{\"text\":\"<h1>Tokenomy<\\\/h1><p>Have you ever \\ufb01nally just gave in to the temptation and read your horoscope in the newspaper on Sunday morning? Sure, we all have. For most of us, it\\u2019s a curiosity, an amusement to see what they say our day will be like based on the sign of the zodiac that we were born under. Sometimes we forget that this little diversion is actually part of an ancient science called astrology that has had a powerful e\\ufb00ect on many cultures dating back to centuries before Christ.<\\\/p><p>That is not to say that astrology is a dead art today. It is easy to \\ufb01nd astrology advocates in every town, advertising in the newspaper and on television trying to convince us that they can tell our fortune, our future and help cure our ills by exploring the mysteries of astrology.<\\\/p><p><img class=\\\"size-full wp-image-182 aligncenter\\\" src=\\\"http:\\\/\\\/unyson\\\/wp-content\\\/uploads\\\/2018\\\/02\\\/forest.jpg\\\" alt=\\\"\\\" width=\\\"900\\\" height=\\\"443\\\" \\\/><\\\/p><h2>Civilisation<\\\/h2><p>When you are a lover of astronomy, the confusion between astronomy and astrology by those who don\\u2019t really understand the di\\ufb00erences can get pretty aggravating. And in early civilizations, the two disciplines were not separate. Astrology was just the religious side of the science of astronomy. So what changed?<\\\/p><p>&nbsp;<\\\/p><p>The most signi\\ufb01cant shift that set in motion the separation of the two lines of thought began in the \\ufb01rst century when Ptolemy wrote the very \\ufb01rst book on astronomy called the Tetrabiblos. In it, he began to suggest that astronomy should be considered a separate science from astrology. It was quite a revolutionary book because it also was the \\ufb01rst scienti\\ufb01c document to suggest that the earth was not the center of the universe and that astronomy should be focused strictly on the observation and recording of events in the cosmos.<\\\/p><p><img class=\\\"alignleft size-medium wp-image-182\\\" src=\\\"http:\\\/\\\/unyson\\\/wp-content\\\/uploads\\\/2018\\\/02\\\/forest-300x148.jpg\\\" alt=\\\"\\\" width=\\\"300\\\" height=\\\"148\\\" \\\/><\\\/p><h3>\\u00a0<strong>Over the next 2000 years, we have come a long way. <\\\/strong><\\\/h3><p><strong>Not only has science and religion completely gone their separate ways <\\\/strong><br \\\/><strong>When<\\\/strong><\\\/p><p>&nbsp;<\\\/p><p>Over the next 2000 years, we have come a long way. Not only has science and religion completely gone their separate ways since Ptolemy but the science of astronomy makes tremendous strides every year that are so phenomenal, Ptolemy would be truly astounded.<\\\/p><p>Probably the biggest point of diversion between a student of astrology and astronomy is the belief that the position of the stars has meaning over the events on our lives. Of course, we do know that the weather and tides and other important aspects of our lives are a\\ufb00ected by the stars, planets and heavenly bodies, particularly the moon. But these things are happening because of completely explainable scienti\\ufb01c laws in motion, not because of mystical forces at work.<\\\/p><h2>Biggest point<\\\/h2><p>Probably the biggest point of diversion between a student of astrology and astronomy is the belief that the position of the stars has meaning over the events on our lives. Of course, we do know that the weather and tides and other important aspects of our lives are a\\ufb00ected by the stars, planets and heavenly bodies, particularly the moon. But these things are happening because of completely explainable scienti\\ufb01c laws in motion, not because of mystical forces at work.<\\\/p><p>What can we, as devotees of astronomy conclude about the close relationship between astrology and astronomy? Well, for sure we want to be able to explain to anyone who is confused by the similarity in the words what the di\\ufb00erences are. We do not want to see the two approaches to the stars and planets to become confused again. But we should do all we can do keep that distinction clear without becoming skeptical or demeaning towards those who may still hold to the teachings of astrology.<\\\/p><p>It is important to remember that what is part of a person\\u2019s religious life has a level of sacred belief to the one holding it. And it is not respectful to sco\\ufb00 at such things. If for no other reason than out of respect for the ancient origins of astronomy, we should give courtesy who still are exploring whether astrology has any validity for them.<\\\/p>\"}}]}]}]"}}}

Sure, we all have. For most of us, it\\u2019s a curiosity, an amusement to see what they say our day will be like based on the sign of the zodiac that we were born under. Sometimes we forget that this little diversion is actually part of an ancient science called astrology that has had a powerful e\\ufb00ect on many cultures dating back to centuries before Christ.<\\\/p><p>That is not to say that astrology is a dead art today. It is easy to \\ufb01nd astrology advocates in every town, advertising in the newspaper and on television trying to convince us that they can tell our fortune, our future and help cure our ills by exploring the mysteries of astrology.<\\\/p><p><img class=\\\"size-full wp-image-182 aligncenter\\\" src=\\\"http:\\\/\\\/unyson\\\/wp-content\\\/uploads\\\/2018\\\/02\\\/forest.jpg\\\" alt=\\\"\\\" width=\\\"900\\\" height=\\\"443\\\" \\\/><\\\/p><h2>Civilisation<\\\/h2><p>When you are a lover of astronomy, the confusion between astronomy and astrology by those who don\\u2019t really understand the di\\ufb00erences can get pretty aggravating. And in early civilizations, the two disciplines were not separate. Astrology was just the religious side of the science of astronomy. So what changed?<\\\/p><p>&nbsp;<\\\/p><p>The most signi\\ufb01cant shift that set in motion the separation of the two lines of thought began in the \\ufb01rst century when Ptolemy wrote the very \\ufb01rst book on astronomy called the Tetrabiblos. In it, he began to suggest that astronomy should be considered a separate science from astrology. It was quite a revolutionary book because it also was the \\ufb01rst scienti\\ufb01c document to suggest that the earth was not the center of the universe and that astronomy should be focused strictly on the observation and recording of events in the cosmos.<\\\/p><p><img class=\\\"alignleft size-medium wp-image-182\\\" src=\\\"http:\\\/\\\/unyson\\\/wp-content\\\/uploads\\\/2018\\\/02\\\/forest-300x148.jpg\\\" alt=\\\"\\\" width=\\\"300\\\" height=\\\"148\\\" \\\/><\\\/p><h3>\\u00a0<strong>Over the next 2000 years, we have come a long way. <\\\/strong><\\\/h3><p><strong>Not only has science and religion completely gone their separate ways <\\\/strong><br \\\/><strong>When<\\\/strong><\\\/p><p>&nbsp;<\\\/p><p>Over the next 2000 years, we have come a long way. Not only has science and religion completely gone their separate ways since Ptolemy but the science of astronomy makes tremendous strides every year that are so phenomenal, Ptolemy would be truly astounded.<\\\/p><p>Probably the biggest point of diversion between a student of astrology and astronomy is the belief that the position of the stars has meaning over the events on our lives. Of course, we do know that the weather and tides and other important aspects of our lives are a\\ufb00ected by the stars, planets and heavenly bodies, particularly the moon. But these things are happening because of completely explainable scienti\\ufb01c laws in motion, not because of mystical forces at work.<\\\/p><h2>Biggest point<\\\/h2><p>Probably the biggest point of diversion between a student of astrology and astronomy is the belief that the position of the stars has meaning over the events on our lives. Of course, we do know that the weather and tides and other important aspects of our lives are a\\ufb00ected by the stars, planets and heavenly bodies, particularly the moon. But these things are happening because of completely explainable scienti\\ufb01c laws in motion, not because of mystical forces at work.<\\\/p><p>What can we, as devotees of astronomy conclude about the close relationship between astrology and astronomy? Well, for sure we want to be able to explain to anyone who is confused by the similarity in the words what the di\\ufb00erences are. We do not want to see the two approaches to the stars and planets to become confused again. But we should do all we can do keep that distinction clear without becoming skeptical or demeaning towards those who may still hold to the teachings of astrology.<\\\/p><p>It is important to remember that what is part of a person\\u2019s religious life has a level of sacred belief to the one holding it. And it is not respectful to sco\\ufb00 at such things. If for no other reason than out of respect for the ancient origins of astronomy, we should give courtesy who still are exploring whether astrology has any validity for them.<\\\/p>\"}}]}]}]"}}}
