\\u041c\\u0438\\u043d\\u0441\\u043a\\u0430\\u044f \\u043e\\u0431\\u043b\\u0430\\u0441\\u0442\\u044c, \\u0411\\u0435\\u043b\\u0430\\u0440\\u0443\\u0441\\u044c\",\"venue\":\"\\u041c\\u0438\\u043d\\u0441\\u043a\",\"address\":\"\",\"city\":\"\\u041c\\u0438\\u043d\\u0441\\u043a\",\"state\":\"\\u041c\\u0438\\u043d\\u0441\\u043a\\u0430\\u044f \\u043e\\u0431\\u043b\\u0430\\u0441\\u0442\\u044c\",\"country\":\"\\u0411\\u0435\\u043b\\u0430\\u0440\\u0443\\u0441\\u044c\",\"zip\":\"\",\"coordinates\":{\"lat\":53.9045398,\"lng\":27.5615244}},\"title\":\"\",\"description\":\"\",\"url\":\"\",\"thumb\":\"\"}]}},\"gmap-key\":\"\",\"map_type\":\"roadmap\",\"map_height\":\"\",\"disable_scrolling\":false}}]},{\"type\":\"column\",\"width\":\"1_1\",\"atts\":{\"custom_class\":\"\",\"anchor\":\"\",\"slide\":false},\"_items\":[{\"type\":\"simple\",\"shortcode\":\"text_block\",\"atts\":{\"text\":\"<h1>Heading 1<\\\/h1><h2>Heading 2<\\\/h2><h3>Heading 3<\\\/h3><p>The word bitcoin first occurred and was defined in the white paper that was published on 31 October 2008. It is a compound of the words bit and coin. The white paper frequently uses the shorter coin. There is no uniform convention for bitcoin capitalization. Some sources use Bitcoin, capitalized, to refer to the technology and network and bitcoin, lowercase, to refer to the unit of account. The Wall Street Journal, The Chronicle of Higher Education, and the Oxford English Dictionary advocate use of lowercase bitcoin in all cases, a convention followed throughout this article.<\\\/p><h4>Heading 4<\\\/h4><p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \\u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\\\/p><h5>Heading 5<\\\/h5><p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \\\"bitcoin.org\\\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\\\/p><h6>Heading 6<\\\/h6><p>In January 2009, the bitcoin network came into existence after Satoshi Nakamoto mined the first ever block on the chain, known as the genesis block. Embedded in the coinbase of this block was the following text:<\\\/p><h2>Unordered Lists<\\\/h2><ul><li>List item one<ul><li>List item one<ul><li>List item one<\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ul><h3>Ordered List<\\\/h3><ol><li>List item one -start at 8<ol><li>List item one<ol reversed=\\\"reversed\\\"><li>List item one -reversed attribute<\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><\\\/li><li>List item two<\\\/li><li>List item three<\\\/li><li>List item four<\\\/li><\\\/ol><blockquote><p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\\\/p><\\\/blockquote>\"}}]}]}]"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"1","post_author":"1","post_date":"2018-01-10 13:29:00","post_date_gmt":"2018-01-10 10:29:00","post_content":"Bitconnect is facing litigation from six individuals accusing the company of operating a Ponzi scheme in addition to numerous violations of securities laws. The six plaintiffs collectively invested approximately $771,000 USD into Bitconnect, and are seeking recourse following the sudden removal of the company\u2019s lending platform that immediately led to a more than 90% loss in the value of Bitconnect tokens.\r\n\r\n<!--more-->\r\n\r\nThe <a href=\"https:\/\/www.scribd.com\/document\/369956633\/Class-Action-Complaint-BitConnect#from_embed\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">complaint<\/a> has been filed by Charles Wildes, Francisco Doria, Aric Harod, Akiva Katz, James Gurry, and Ronald Nelson with the Southern District Court of Florida, and is made on behalf of all Bitconnect customers, in addition to the aforementioned plaintiffs individually.\r\n\r\nThe suit has been brought against all three corporate entities comprising the Bitconnect company, in addition to defendants \u201cGlenn Arcaro, Trevon Brown a\/k\/a Trevon James, Ryan Hildreth, Craig Grant, and Cryptonick\u201d \u2013 who are accused of aggressively recruiting new investors into the Ponzi scheme using social media.\r\n<h2>Bitconnect Accused of Running \u201cWide-Reaching Ponzi Scheme\u201d<\/h2>\r\nThe preliminary statement of the complaint describes Bitconnect as having raised \u201cmillions of dollars\u2019 worth of cryptocurrency\u201d through \u201ca trading platform and lending program fraudulently promoted and operated by\u201d the defendants.\r\n\r\nThe complaint states that \u201cBitconnect guaranteed investors up to a forty percent total return per month on their investments, following a four-tier investment system based on the sum of the initial deposit.\u201d Investors were \u201cpromised a one percent return on investment on a daily basis, which Bitconnect purported would be generated by its own proprietary trading bot and volatility software,\u201d which was to be paid out \u201cregardless of market performance or the fluctuating price of cryptocurrency.\u201d An investment of just one thousand dollars would grow to generate a $50 million return within three years of compounding daily interest, the company is reported to have shilled.\r\n\r\nThe plaintiffs state that Bitconnect\u2019s former $2.5 billion market capitalization was \u201cbuilt through the use of fraudulent means,\u201d in particular \u201ca wide-reaching Ponzi scheme that defrauded investors, made a mockery of state and federal securities laws, and employed an army of social media mercenaries who were paid to bring more unsuspecting victims into the fraud.\u201d","post_title":"Wide-Reaching Ponzi Scheme","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"publish","comment_status":"open","ping_status":"open","post_password":"","post_name":"%d0%bf%d1%80%d0%b8%d0%b2%d0%b5%d1%82-%d0%bc%d0%b8%d1%80","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2018-04-26 profit based on a 25% reinvestment strategy and current mining difficulty &amp; market conditions. profit based on a 25% reinvestment strategy and current mining difficulty &amp; market conditions. market conditions. It includes 9% overhead cost for management, R&amp;D and other company cost and takes into account 17% of tokens that are not distributed (see white paper for distribution).<\/p> \n <p class=\"heading-3\">Invest<\/p>\n <p class=\"dividend_invest-sum\">$50000<\/p>\n <p class=\"dividend_amounts-title\">Projected token profit:<\/p>\n $\n Year 1\n $\n Year 2\n $\n Year 3\n $\n Year 4\n $\n Year 5\n $\n Total\n <p>\n Get \n (Projected profit)\n <\/p>\n <p class=\"dividend_legend-description\">\n Reinvestment\n <\/p>\n Y1\n Y2\n Y3\n Y4\n Y5\n <h3 class=\"heading-3\">Return on Investment: 163% per year<\/h3>\n <p>Annual token profit projection based on investment.<\/p>\n <a href=\"#\" class=\"button\">Invest<\/a>\n\n<!-- cfa3216d11e9725a601c30fd21a4a40d -->","post_title":"Homepage","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"5-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2018-01-26 18:49:40","post_modified_gmt":"2018-01-26 15:49:40","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"5","guid":"http:\/\/unyson\/2018\/01\/26\/5-revision-v1\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"revision","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"117","post_author":"1","post_date":"2018-01-26 18:55:24","post_date_gmt":"2018-01-26 15:55:24","post_content":"Bitconnect is facing litigation from six individuals accusing the company of operating a Ponzi scheme in addition to numerous violations of securities laws. The six plaintiffs collectively invested approximately $771,000 USD into Bitconnect, and are seeking recourse following the sudden removal of the company\u2019s lending platform that immediately led to a more than 90% loss in the value of Bitconnect tokens.\r\n\r\n<!--more-->\r\n\r\nThe <a href=\"https:\/\/www.scribd.com\/document\/369956633\/Class-Action-Complaint-BitConnect#from_embed\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">complaint<\/a> has been filed by Charles Wildes, Francisco Doria, Aric Harod, Akiva Katz, James Gurry, and Ronald Nelson with the Southern District Court of Florida, and is made on behalf of all Bitconnect customers, in addition to the aforementioned plaintiffs individually.\r\n\r\nThe suit has been brought against all three corporate entities comprising the Bitconnect company, in addition to defendants \u201cGlenn Arcaro, Trevon Brown a\/k\/a Trevon James, Ryan Hildreth, Craig Grant, and Cryptonick\u201d \u2013 who are accused of aggressively recruiting new investors into the Ponzi scheme using social media.\r\n<h2>Bitconnect Accused of Running \u201cWide-Reaching Ponzi Scheme\u201d<\/h2>\r\nThe preliminary statement of the complaint describes Bitconnect as having raised \u201cmillions of dollars\u2019 worth of cryptocurrency\u201d through \u201ca trading platform and lending program fraudulently promoted and operated by\u201d the defendants.\r\n\r\nThe complaint states that \u201cBitconnect guaranteed investors up to a forty percent total return per month on their investments, following a four-tier investment system based on the sum of the initial deposit.\u201d Investors were \u201cpromised a one percent return on investment on a daily basis, which Bitconnect purported would be generated by its own proprietary trading bot and volatility software,\u201d which was to be paid out \u201cregardless of market performance or the fluctuating price of cryptocurrency.\u201d An investment of just one thousand dollars would grow to generate a $50 million return within three years of compounding daily interest, the company is reported to have shilled.\r\n\r\nThe plaintiffs state that Bitconnect\u2019s former $2.5 billion market capitalization was \u201cbuilt through the use of fraudulent means,\u201d in particular \u201ca wide-reaching Ponzi scheme that defrauded investors, made a mockery of state and federal securities laws, and employed an army of social media mercenaries who were paid to bring more unsuspecting victims into the fraud.\u201d","post_title":"Bitconnect Faces Lawsuit for Operating \u201cWide-Reaching Ponzi Scheme\u201d","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"publish","comment_status":"open","ping_status":"open","post_password":"","post_name":"bitconnect-faces-lawsuit-for-operating-wide-reaching-ponzi-scheme","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2018-04-26 18:11:44","post_modified_gmt":"2018-04-26 15:11:44","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"0","guid":"http:\/\/unyson\/?p=117","menu_order":"0","post_type":"post","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"3"}}}
{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"118","post_author":"1","post_date":"2018-01-26 18:55:24","post_date_gmt":"2018-01-26 15:55:24","post_content":"<strong>Bitconnect is facing litigation from six individuals accusing the company of operating a Ponzi scheme in addition to numerous violations of securities laws. The six plaintiffs collectively invested approximately $771,000 USD into Bitconnect, and are seeking recourse following the sudden removal of the company\u2019s lending platform that immediately led to a more than 90% loss in the value of Bitconnect tokens.<\/strong>\r\n\r\n<!--more-->\r\n\r\nThe <a href=\"https:\/\/www.scribd.com\/document\/369956633\/Class-Action-Complaint-BitConnect#from_embed\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">complaint<\/a> has been filed by Charles Wildes, Francisco Doria, Aric Harod, Akiva Katz, James Gurry, and Ronald Nelson with the Southern District Court of Florida, and is made on behalf of all Bitconnect customers, in addition to the aforementioned plaintiffs individually.\r\n\r\nThe suit has been brought against all three corporate entities comprising the Bitconnect company, in addition to defendants \u201cGlenn Arcaro, Trevon Brown a\/k\/a Trevon James, Ryan Hildreth, Craig Grant, and Cryptonick\u201d \u2013 who are accused of aggressively recruiting new investors into the Ponzi scheme using social media.\r\n<h2>Bitconnect Accused of Running \u201cWide-Reaching Ponzi Scheme\u201d<\/h2>\r\nThe preliminary statement of the complaint describes Bitconnect as having raised \u201cmillions of dollars\u2019 worth of cryptocurrency\u201d through \u201ca trading platform and lending program fraudulently promoted and operated by\u201d the defendants.\r\n\r\nThe complaint states that \u201cBitconnect guaranteed investors up to a forty percent total return per month on their investments, following a four-tier investment system based on the sum of the initial deposit.\u201d Investors were \u201cpromised a one percent return on investment on a daily basis, which Bitconnect purported would be generated by its own proprietary trading bot and volatility software,\u201d which was to be paid out \u201cregardless of market performance or the fluctuating price of cryptocurrency.\u201d An investment of just one thousand dollars would grow to generate a $50 million return within three years of compounding daily interest, the company is reported to have shilled.\r\n\r\nThe plaintiffs state that Bitconnect\u2019s former $2.5 billion market capitalization was \u201cbuilt through the use of fraudulent means,\u201d in particular \u201ca wide-reaching Ponzi scheme that defrauded investors, made a mockery of state and federal securities laws, and employed an army of social media mercenaries who were paid to bring more unsuspecting victims into the fraud.\u201d","post_title":"Bitconnect Faces Lawsuit for Operating \u201cWide-Reaching Ponzi Scheme\u201d","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"117-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2018-01-26 18:55:24","post_modified_gmt":"2018-01-26 15:55:24","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"117","guid":"http:\/\/unyson\/2018\/01\/26\/117-revision-v1\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"revision","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"124","post_author":"1","post_date":"2018-01-30 13:57:44","post_date_gmt":"2018-01-30 10:57:44","post_content":"<h1 style=\"text-align: {"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"139","post_author":"1","post_date":"2018-01-31 11:38:44","post_date_gmt":"2018-01-31 08:38:44","post_content":"<p>Have you ever \ufb01nally just gave in to the temptation and read your horoscope in the newspaper on Sunday morning? Sure, we all have. For most of us, it\u2019s a curiosity, an amusement to see what they say our day will be like based on the sign of the zodiac that we were born under. Sometimes we forget that this little diversion is actually part of an ancient science called astrology that has had a powerful e\ufb00ect on many cultures dating back to centuries before Christ.<\/p><p>That is not to say that astrology is a dead art today. It is easy to \ufb01nd astrology advocates in every town, advertising in the newspaper and on television trying to convince us that they can tell our fortune, our future and help cure our ills by exploring the mysteries of astrology.<\/p><p><img class=\"size-full wp-image-182 aligncenter\" src=\"http:\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/02\/forest.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"900\" height=\"443\" \/><\/p><h2>Civilisation<\/h2><p>When you are a lover of astronomy, the confusion between astronomy and astrology by those who don\u2019t really understand the di\ufb00erences can get pretty aggravating. And in early civilizations, the two disciplines were not separate. Astrology was just the religious side of the science of astronomy. So what changed?<\/p>\n<img src=\"\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/02\/map.jpg\" alt=\"\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/02\/map.jpg\" class=\"full-width\" \/>\n <p>The most signi\ufb01cant shift that set in motion the separation of the two lines of thought began in the \ufb01rst century when Ptolemy wrote the very \ufb01rst book on astronomy called the Tetrabiblos. In it, he began to suggest that astronomy should be considered a separate science from astrology. It was quite a revolutionary book because it also was the \ufb01rst scienti\ufb01c document to suggest that the earth was not the center of the universe and that astronomy should be focused strictly on the observation and recording of events in the cosmos.<\/p><p><img class=\"alignleft size-full wp-image-194\" src=\"http:\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/02\/forest-small.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"580\" height=\"434\" \/><\/p><p>&nbsp;<\/p><p>Over the next 2000 years, we have come a long way. <\/p><p>Not only has science and religion completely gone their separate ways <\/p><p>&nbsp;<\/p><p>Over the next 2000 years, we have come a long way. Not only has science and religion completely gone their separate ways since Ptolemy but the science of astronomy makes tremendous strides every year that are so phenomenal, Ptolemy would be truly astounded.<\/p><p>Probably the biggest point of diversion between a student of astrology and astronomy is the belief that the position of the stars has meaning over the events on our lives. Of course, we do know that the weather and tides and other important aspects of our lives are a\ufb00ected by the stars, planets and heavenly bodies, particularly the moon. But these things are happening because of completely explainable scienti\ufb01c laws in motion, not because of mystical forces at work.<\/p><p> #bwg_container1_0 #bwg_container2_0 .bwg_standart_thumbnails_0 * { -moz-box-sizing: border-box; box-sizing: border-box; } #bwg_container1_0 #bwg_container2_0 .bwg_standart_thumb_spun1_0 { -moz-box-sizing: content-box; box-sizing: content-box; background-color: #FFFFFF; display: inline-block; height: 220px; -ms-backface-visibility: hidden; opacity: 1; filter: Alpha(opacity=100); transform: scale(1.1); z-index: 102; position: relative; } #bwg_container1_0 #bwg_container2_0 .bwg_standart_thumb_spun2_0 { border: 0px none #CCCCCC; border-radius: 0; box-shadow: 0px 0px 0px #888888; display: inline-block; height: 220px; overflow: hidden; width: 220px; } #bwg_container1_0 #bwg_container2_0 .bwg_standart_thumbnails_0 { background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.00); display: inline-block; font-size: 0; max-width: 928px; text-align: center; } #bwg_container1_0 #bwg_container2_0 .bwg_standart_thumb_0 { display: inline-block; text-align: center; } #bwg_container1_0 #bwg_container2_0 .bwg_standart_thumb_spun1_0:hover .bwg_title_spun1_0 { left: 0px; top: 0px; opacity: 1; filter: Alpha(opacity=100); } #bwg_container1_0 #bwg_container2_0 .bwg_title_spun2_0 { color: #CCCCCC; display: table-cell; font-family: segoe ui; font-size: 16px; font-weight: bold; height: inherit; padding: 2px; text-shadow: 0px 0px 0px #888888; vertical-align: middle; width: inherit; word-wrap: break-word; } \/*pagination styles*\/ #bwg_container1_0 #bwg_container2_0 .tablenav-pages_0 { text-align: center; }, 100); bwg_gallery_box_0(jQuery(this).attr(\"data-image-id\")); return false; } }); } jQuery(document).ready(function () { bwg_document_ready_0(); }); <\/p><h2>Biggest point<\/h2><p>Probably the biggest point of diversion between a student of astrology and astronomy is the belief that the position of the stars has meaning over the events on our lives. Of course, we do know that the weather and tides and other important aspects of our lives are a\ufb00ected by the stars, planets and heavenly bodies, particularly the moon. But these things are happening because of completely explainable scienti\ufb01c laws in motion, not because of mystical forces at work.<\/p><p>What can we, as devotees of astronomy conclude about the close relationship between astrology and astronomy? Well, for sure we want to be able to explain to anyone who is confused by the similarity in the words what the di\ufb00erences are. We do not want to see the two approaches to the stars and planets to become confused again. But we should do all we can do keep that distinction clear without becoming skeptical or demeaning towards those who may still hold to the teachings of astrology.<\/p><p>It is important to remember that what is part of a person\u2019s religious life has a level of sacred belief to the one holding it. And it is not respectful to sco\ufb00 at such things. If for no other reason than out of respect for the ancient origins of astronomy, we should give courtesy who still are exploring whether astrology has any validity for them.<\/p>\n\n<!-- 0f5428f8a23fe99cb22c6788f9d531de -->","post_title":"Tokenomy","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"publish","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"typography","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2018-03-08 22:17:03","post_modified_gmt":"2018-03-08 19:17:03","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"0","guid":"http:\/\/unyson\/?page_id=139","menu_order":"0","post_type":"page","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}
{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"140","post_author":"1","post_date":"2018-01-31 11:38:44","post_date_gmt":"2018-01-31 08:38:44","post_content":"<h1>Heading 1<\/h1>\r\nBitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.\r\n<h2>Heading 2<\/h2>\r\nBitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. They can be exchanged for other currencies, products, and services. As of February 2015, over 100,000 merchants and vendors accepted bitcoin as payment. Research produced by the University of Cambridge estimates that in 2017, there are 2.9 to 5.8 million unique users using a cryptocurrency wallet, most of them using bitcoin.\r\n<h3>Heading 3<\/h3>\r\nThe word bitcoin first occurred and was defined in the white paper that was published on 31 October 2008. It is a compound of the words bit and coin. The white paper frequently uses the shorter coin. There is no uniform convention for bitcoin capitalization. Some sources use Bitcoin, capitalized, to refer to the technology and network and bitcoin, lowercase, to refer to the unit of account. The Wall Street Journal, The Chronicle of Higher Education, and the Oxford English Dictionary advocate use of lowercase bitcoin in all cases, a convention followed throughout this article.\r\n<h4>Heading 4<\/h4>\r\nThe unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.\r\n<h5>Heading 5<\/h5>\r\nOn 18 August 2008, the domain name \"bitcoin.org\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.\r\n<h6>Heading 6<\/h6>\r\nIn January 2009, the bitcoin network came into existence after Satoshi Nakamoto mined the first ever block on the chain, known as the genesis block. Embedded in the coinbase of this block was the following text:","post_title":"Typography","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"139-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2018-01-31 11:38:44","post_modified_gmt":"2018-01-31 08:38:44","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"139","guid":"http:\/\/unyson\/2018\/01\/31\/139-revision-v1\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"revision","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"143","post_author":"1","post_date":"2018-01-31 11:53:39","post_date_gmt":"2018-01-31 08:53:39","post_content":"<h1>Heading 1<\/h1><p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\/p><h2>Heading 2<\/h2><p>Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. They can be exchanged for other currencies, products, and services. As of February 2015, over 100,000 merchants and vendors accepted bitcoin as payment. Research produced by the University of Cambridge estimates that in 2017, there are 2.9 to 5.8 million unique users using a cryptocurrency wallet, most of them using bitcoin.<\/p><h3>Heading 3<\/h3><p>The word bitcoin first occurred and was defined in the white paper that was published on 31 October 2008. It is a compound of the words bit and coin. The white paper frequently uses the shorter coin. There is no uniform convention for bitcoin capitalization. Some sources use Bitcoin, capitalized, to refer to the technology and network and bitcoin, lowercase, to refer to the unit of account. The Wall Street Journal, The Chronicle of Higher Education, and the Oxford English Dictionary advocate use of lowercase bitcoin in all cases, a convention followed throughout this article.<\/p><h4>Heading 4<\/h4><p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\/p><h5>Heading 5<\/h5><p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \"bitcoin.org\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\/p><h6>Heading 6<\/h6><p>In January 2009, the bitcoin network came into existence after Satoshi Nakamoto mined the first ever block on the chain, known as the genesis block. Embedded in the coinbase of this block was the following text:<\/p>\n\n<!-- 20438a2136fa53882e6d091cc5cfe9c6 -->","post_title":"Typography","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"139-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2018-01-31 11:53:39","post_modified_gmt":"2018-01-31 08:53:39","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"139","guid":"http:\/\/unyson\/2018\/01\/31\/139-revision-v1\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"revision","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}
{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"144","post_author":"1","post_date":"2018-01-31 12:02:53","post_date_gmt":"2018-01-31 09:02:53","post_content":"<h3>Image<\/h3><img src=\"\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/image-1.png\" alt=\"\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/image-1.png\" \/>\n <h3>Contact<\/h3>\n First Name * \n Last name * \n Email * \n Radio buttons * \n Radio 1\n Radio 2\n Radio 3\n Checkboxes * \n Checkbox 1\n Checkbox 2\n Checkbox 3\n Message * \n <h3>Video<\/h3>\n <h3>Tabs<\/h3>\n <a href=\"#fw-tabs-5ae1e4016dda1-1\">Tab 1<\/a>\n <a href=\"#fw-tabs-5ae1e4016dda1-2\">Tab 2<\/a>\n <p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\/p>\n <p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \"bitcoin.org\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\/p>\n <h3>Accordion<\/h3>\n <h3 class=\"fw-accordion-title\">Tab 1<\/h3>\n <p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\/p>\n <h3 class=\"fw-accordion-title\">Tab 2<\/h3>\n <p>Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. They can be exchanged for other currencies, products, and services. As of February 2015, over 100,000 merchants and vendors accepted bitcoin as payment. Research produced by the University of Cambridge estimates that in 2017, there are 2.9 to 5.8 million unique users using a cryptocurrency wallet, most of them using bitcoin.<\/p>\n <h3>Table<\/h3>\n Table header 1 \n Table header 2 \n Table header 3 \n Table row 1 \n Data \n Data \n Data \n Table row 2 \n Data \n Data \n Data \n Table row 3 \n Data \n Data \n Data \n <h3>Buttons<\/h3><a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 \">\n Default button\n<\/a>\n<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 fw-btn-white\">\n White button\n<\/a>\n<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 fw-btn-yellow\">\n Yellow button\n<\/a>\n<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 fw-btn-big\">\n Big button\n<\/a>\n<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 fw-btn-big-yellow\">\n Big yellow button\n<\/a>\n<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 fw-btn-big-white\">\n Big white button\n<\/a>\n <h3>Icons<\/h3>\n <h3>Block with icon<\/h3>\n <p>Block description.<\/p>\n<h4>Simple icons<\/h4>\n <h3>Map<\/h3>\n <h1>Heading 1<\/h1><h2>Heading 2<\/h2><h3>Heading 3<\/h3><p>The word bitcoin first occurred and was defined in the white paper that was published on 31 October 2008. It is a compound of the words bit and coin. The white paper frequently uses the shorter coin. There is no uniform convention for bitcoin capitalization. Some sources use Bitcoin, capitalized, to refer to the technology and network and bitcoin, lowercase, to refer to the unit of account. The Wall Street Journal, The Chronicle of Higher Education, and the Oxford English Dictionary advocate use of lowercase bitcoin in all cases, a convention followed throughout this article.<\/p><h4>Heading 4<\/h4><p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\/p><h5>Heading 5<\/h5><p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \"bitcoin.org\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\/p><h6>Heading 6<\/h6><p>In January 2009, the bitcoin network came into existence after Satoshi Nakamoto mined the first ever block on the chain, known as the genesis block. Embedded in the coinbase of this block was the following text:<\/p><h2>Unordered Lists<\/h2>List item oneList item oneList item oneList item twoList item threeList item fourList item twoList item threeList item fourList item twoList item threeList item four<h3>Ordered List<\/h3>List item one -start at 8List item oneList item one -reversed attributeList item twoList item threeList item fourList item twoList item threeList item fourList item twoList item threeList item four<p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\/p>\n\n<!-- f8dcf909ea2889cc995f5c0b9261ee57 -->","post_title":"Elements","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"publish","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"elements","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2018-04-26 17:36:49","post_modified_gmt":"2018-04-26 14:36:49","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"0","guid":"http:\/\/unyson\/?page_id=144","menu_order":"0","post_type":"page","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"148","post_author":"1","post_date":"2018-01-31 12:04:38","post_date_gmt":"2018-01-31 09:04:38","post_content":"<h3>Image<\/h3><img src=\"http:\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/image-1-300x200.png\" alt=\"http:\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/image-1-300x200.png\" width=\"300\" height=\"200\" \/>\n <h3>Video<\/h3>\n <h3>Accordion<\/h3><p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n <h3 class=\"fw-accordion-title\">Tab 1<\/h3>\n <p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\/p>\n <h3 class=\"fw-accordion-title\">Tab 2<\/h3>\n <p>Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. They can be exchanged for other currencies, products, and services. As of February 2015, over 100,000 merchants and vendors accepted bitcoin as payment. Research produced by the University of Cambridge estimates that in 2017, there are 2.9 to 5.8 million unique users using a cryptocurrency wallet, most of them using bitcoin.<\/p>\n\n<!-- 99f30a74d6c602d4a09f0e31022a9ad5 -->","post_title":"Elements","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"144-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2018-01-31 12:04:38","post_modified_gmt":"2018-01-31 09:04:38","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"144","guid":"http:\/\/unyson\/2018\/01\/31\/144-revision-v1\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"revision","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}

These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. {"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"155","post_author":"1","post_date":"2018-01-31 12:15:29","post_date_gmt":"2018-01-31 09:15:29","post_content":"<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 \">\n Submit\n<\/a>\n <h3>Image<\/h3><img src=\"http:\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/image-1-300x200.png\" alt=\"http:\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/image-1-300x200.png\" width=\"300\" height=\"200\" \/>\n <h3>Video<\/h3>\n <h3>Accordion<\/h3><p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n <h3 class=\"fw-accordion-title\">Tab 1<\/h3>\n <p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\/p>\n <h3 class=\"fw-accordion-title\">Tab 2<\/h3>\n <p>Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. They can be exchanged for other currencies, products, and services. As of February 2015, over 100,000 merchants and vendors accepted bitcoin as payment. Research produced by the University of Cambridge estimates that in 2017, there are 2.9 to 5.8 million unique users using a cryptocurrency wallet, most of them using bitcoin.<\/p>\n <h3>Calendar<\/h3>\n \u0421\u0435\u0433\u043e\u0434\u043d\u044f\n <h3><\/h3>\n <h3>Map<\/h3>\n <h3>Buttons<\/h3><a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 \">\n Default button\n<\/a>\n<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 fw-btn-white\">\n White button\n<\/a>\n<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 fw-btn-yellow\">\n Yellow button\n<\/a>\n <h3>Map<\/h3>\n <a href=\"#fw-tabs-5a71893131673-1\">Tab 1<\/a>\n <a href=\"#fw-tabs-5a71893131673-2\">Tab 2<\/a>\n <p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\/p>\n <p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \"bitcoin.org\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\/p>\n <h3>Table<\/h3>\n Table row 1\n Table row 2\n Table row 3\n Table header 1 \n Data\n Data\n Data\n Table header 2 \n Data\n Data\n Data\n Table header 3 \n Data\n Data\n Data\n <h3>Notification<\/h3>\n \u041f\u043e\u0437\u0434\u0440\u0430\u0432\u043b\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0435! Congratulations\n \u0418\u043d\u0444\u043e\u0440\u043c\u0430\u0446\u0438\u044f! Information\n \u041f\u0440\u0435\u0434\u0443\u043f\u0440\u0435\u0436\u0434\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0435! Warning\n \u041e\u0448\u0438\u0431\u043a\u0430! Error\n\n<!-- d62a30d0eb1a712465cb4dcf8341016b -->","post_title":"Elements","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"144-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2018-01-31 12:15:29","post_modified_gmt":"2018-01-31 09:15:29","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"144","guid":"http:\/\/unyson\/2018\/01\/31\/144-revision-v1\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"revision","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}
{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"156","post_author":"1","post_date":"2018-01-31 12:18:04","post_date_gmt":"2018-01-31 09:18:04","post_content":"<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 \">\n Submit\n<\/a>\n <h3>Image<\/h3><img src=\"http:\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/image-1-300x200.png\" alt=\"http:\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/image-1-300x200.png\" width=\"300\" height=\"200\" \/>\n <h3>Video<\/h3>\n <h3>Accordion<\/h3><p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n <h3 class=\"fw-accordion-title\">Tab 1<\/h3>\n <p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\/p>\n <h3 class=\"fw-accordion-title\">Tab 2<\/h3>\n <p>Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. They can be exchanged for other currencies, products, and services. As of February 2015, over 100,000 merchants and vendors accepted bitcoin as payment. Research produced by the University of Cambridge estimates that in 2017, there are 2.9 to 5.8 million unique users using a cryptocurrency wallet, most of them using bitcoin.<\/p>\n <h3>Calendar<\/h3>\n \u0421\u0435\u0433\u043e\u0434\u043d\u044f\n <h3><\/h3>\n <h3>Map<\/h3>\n <h3>Buttons<\/h3><a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 \">\n Default button\n<\/a>\n<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 fw-btn-white\">\n White button\n<\/a>\n<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 fw-btn-yellow\">\n Yellow button\n<\/a>\n <h3>Map<\/h3>\n <a href=\"#fw-tabs-5a7189cc995e5-1\">Tab 1<\/a>\n <a href=\"#fw-tabs-5a7189cc995e5-2\">Tab 2<\/a>\n <p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\/p>\n <p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \"bitcoin.org\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\/p>\n <h3>Table<\/h3>\n Table row 1\n Table row 2\n Table row 3\n Table header 1 \n Data\n Data\n Data\n Table header 2 \n Data\n Data\n Data\n Table header 3 \n Data\n Data\n Data\n <h3>Notification<\/h3>\n \u041f\u043e\u0437\u0434\u0440\u0430\u0432\u043b\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0435! Congratulations\n \u0418\u043d\u0444\u043e\u0440\u043c\u0430\u0446\u0438\u044f! Information\n \u041f\u0440\u0435\u0434\u0443\u043f\u0440\u0435\u0436\u0434\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0435! Warning\n \u041e\u0448\u0438\u0431\u043a\u0430! Error\n <h3>Icons<\/h3>\n <h3><\/h3>\n <p><\/p>\n\n<!-- e73e187a42c69c46ba5251e827b9ae00 -->","post_title":"Elements","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"144-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2018-01-31 12:18:04","post_modified_gmt":"2018-01-31 09:18:04","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"144","guid":"http:\/\/unyson\/2018\/01\/31\/144-revision-v1\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"revision","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}
{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"157","post_author":"1","post_date":"2018-01-31 12:18:36","post_date_gmt":"2018-01-31 09:18:36","post_content":"<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 \">\n Submit\n<\/a>\n <h3>Image<\/h3><img src=\"http:\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/image-1-300x200.png\" alt=\"http:\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/image-1-300x200.png\" width=\"300\" height=\"200\" \/>\n <h3>Video<\/h3>\n <h3>Accordion<\/h3><p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n <h3 class=\"fw-accordion-title\">Tab 1<\/h3>\n <p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\/p>\n <h3 class=\"fw-accordion-title\">Tab 2<\/h3>\n <p>Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. They can be exchanged for other currencies, products, and services. As of February 2015, over 100,000 merchants and vendors accepted bitcoin as payment. Research produced by the University of Cambridge estimates that in 2017, there are 2.9 to 5.8 million unique users using a cryptocurrency wallet, most of them using bitcoin.<\/p>\n <h3>Calendar<\/h3>\n \u0421\u0435\u0433\u043e\u0434\u043d\u044f\n <h3><\/h3>\n <h3>Map<\/h3>\n <h3>Buttons<\/h3><a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 \">\n Default button\n<\/a>\n<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 fw-btn-white\">\n White button\n<\/a>\n<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 fw-btn-yellow\">\n Yellow button\n<\/a>\n <h3>Map<\/h3>\n <a href=\"#fw-tabs-5a7189ecc571e-1\">Tab 1<\/a>\n <a href=\"#fw-tabs-5a7189ecc571e-2\">Tab 2<\/a>\n <p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\/p>\n <p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \"bitcoin.org\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\/p>\n <h3>Table<\/h3>\n Table row 1\n Table row 2\n Table row 3\n Table header 1 \n Data\n Data\n Data\n Table header 2 \n Data\n Data\n Data\n Table header 3 \n Data\n Data\n Data\n <h3>Notification<\/h3>\n \u041f\u043e\u0437\u0434\u0440\u0430\u0432\u043b\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0435! {"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"161","post_author":"1","post_date":"2018-01-31 12:30:36","post_date_gmt":"2018-01-31 09:30:36","post_content":"<h3>Image<\/h3><img src=\"http:\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/image-1-300x200.png\" alt=\"http:\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/image-1-300x200.png\" width=\"300\" height=\"200\" \/>\n <h3>Video<\/h3>\n <h3>Accordion<\/h3><p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n <h3 class=\"fw-accordion-title\">Tab 1<\/h3>\n <p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\/p>\n <h3 class=\"fw-accordion-title\">Tab 2<\/h3>\n <p>Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. They can be exchanged for other currencies, products, and services. As of February 2015, over 100,000 merchants and vendors accepted bitcoin as payment. Research produced by the University of Cambridge estimates that in 2017, there are 2.9 to 5.8 million unique users using a cryptocurrency wallet, most of them using bitcoin.<\/p>\n <h3>Calendar<\/h3>\n \u0421\u0435\u0433\u043e\u0434\u043d\u044f\n <h3><\/h3>\n <h3>Map<\/h3>\n <h3>Buttons<\/h3><a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 \">\n Default button\n<\/a>\n<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 fw-btn-white\">\n White button\n<\/a>\n<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 fw-btn-yellow\">\n Yellow button\n<\/a>\n <h3>Map<\/h3>\n <a href=\"#fw-tabs-5a718cbc286e4-1\">Tab 1<\/a>\n <a href=\"#fw-tabs-5a718cbc286e4-2\">Tab 2<\/a>\n <p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\/p>\n <p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \"bitcoin.org\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\/p>\n <h3>Table<\/h3>\n Table row 1\n Table row 2\n Table row 3\n Table header 1 \n Data\n Data\n Data\n Table header 2 \n Data\n Data\n Data\n Table header 3 \n Data\n Data\n Data\n <h3>Notification<\/h3>\n \u041f\u043e\u0437\u0434\u0440\u0430\u0432\u043b\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0435! \n Radio 1\n Radio 2\n Radio 3\n \u0412\u044b\u043f\u0430\u0434\u0430\u044e\u0449\u0438\u0439 \u0441\u043f\u0438\u0441\u043e\u043a * \n Value 1\n Value 2\n Value 3\n \u0422\u0435\u043a\u0441\u0442 {"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"162","post_author":"1","post_date":"2018-01-31 12:37:12","post_date_gmt":"2018-01-31 09:37:12","post_content":"<h3>Image<\/h3><img src=\"http:\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/image-1-300x200.png\" alt=\"http:\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/image-1-300x200.png\" width=\"300\" height=\"200\" \/>\n <h3>Video<\/h3>\n <h3>Accordion<\/h3><p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n <h3 class=\"fw-accordion-title\">Tab 1<\/h3>\n <p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\/p>\n <h3 class=\"fw-accordion-title\">Tab 2<\/h3>\n <p>Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. They can be exchanged for other currencies, products, and services. As of February 2015, over 100,000 merchants and vendors accepted bitcoin as payment. Research produced by the University of Cambridge estimates that in 2017, there are 2.9 to 5.8 million unique users using a cryptocurrency wallet, most of them using bitcoin.<\/p>\n <h3>Calendar<\/h3>\n \u0421\u0435\u0433\u043e\u0434\u043d\u044f\n <h3><\/h3>\n <h3>Map<\/h3>\n <h3>Buttons<\/h3><a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 \">\n Default button\n<\/a>\n<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 fw-btn-white\">\n White button\n<\/a>\n<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 fw-btn-yellow\">\n Yellow button\n<\/a>\n <h3>Map<\/h3>\n <a href=\"#fw-tabs-5a718e48e284a-1\">Tab 1<\/a>\n <a href=\"#fw-tabs-5a718e48e284a-2\">Tab 2<\/a>\n <p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\/p>\n <p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \"bitcoin.org\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\/p>\n <h3>Table<\/h3>\n Table header 1 \n Table header 2 \n Table header 3 \n Table row 1 \n Data \n Data \n Data \n Table row 2 \n Data \n Data \n Data \n Table row 3 \n Data \n Data \n Data \n <h3>Notification<\/h3>\n \u041f\u043e\u0437\u0434\u0440\u0430\u0432\u043b\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0435! {"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"164","post_author":"1","post_date":"2018-01-31 12:48:32","post_date_gmt":"2018-01-31 09:48:32","post_content":"<h3>Image<\/h3><img src=\"\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/image-1.png\" alt=\"\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/image-1.png\" \/>\n <h3>Video<\/h3>\n <h3>Accordion<\/h3><p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n <h3 class=\"fw-accordion-title\">Tab 1<\/h3>\n <p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\/p>\n <h3 class=\"fw-accordion-title\">Tab 2<\/h3>\n <p>Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. They can be exchanged for other currencies, products, and services. As of February 2015, over 100,000 merchants and vendors accepted bitcoin as payment. Research produced by the University of Cambridge estimates that in 2017, there are 2.9 to 5.8 million unique users using a cryptocurrency wallet, most of them using bitcoin.<\/p>\n <h3>Calendar<\/h3>\n \u0421\u0435\u0433\u043e\u0434\u043d\u044f\n <h3><\/h3>\n <h3>Map<\/h3>\n <h3>Buttons<\/h3><a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 \">\n Default button\n<\/a>\n<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 fw-btn-white\">\n White button\n<\/a>\n<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 fw-btn-yellow\">\n Yellow button\n<\/a>\n <h3>Map<\/h3>\n <a href=\"#fw-tabs-5a7190f0136b7-1\">Tab 1<\/a>\n <a href=\"#fw-tabs-5a7190f0136b7-2\">Tab 2<\/a>\n <p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\/p>\n <p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \"bitcoin.org\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\/p>\n <h3>Table<\/h3>\n Table header 1 \n Table header 2 \n Table header 3 \n Table row 1 \n Data \n Data \n Data \n Table row 2 \n Data \n Data \n Data \n Table row 3 \n Data \n Data \n Data \n <h3>Notification<\/h3>\n \u041f\u043e\u0437\u0434\u0440\u0430\u0432\u043b\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0435! {"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"165","post_author":"1","post_date":"2018-01-31 13:50:37","post_date_gmt":"2018-01-31 10:50:37","post_content":"<h3>Image<\/h3><img src=\"\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/image-1.png\" alt=\"\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/image-1.png\" \/>\n <h3>Video<\/h3>\n <h3>Accordion<\/h3><p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n <h3 class=\"fw-accordion-title\">Tab 1<\/h3>\n <p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\/p>\n <h3 class=\"fw-accordion-title\">Tab 2<\/h3>\n <p>Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. They can be exchanged for other currencies, products, and services. As of February 2015, over 100,000 merchants and vendors accepted bitcoin as payment. Research produced by the University of Cambridge estimates that in 2017, there are 2.9 to 5.8 million unique users using a cryptocurrency wallet, most of them using bitcoin.<\/p>\n <h3>Calendar<\/h3>\n \u0421\u0435\u0433\u043e\u0434\u043d\u044f\n <h3><\/h3>\n <h3>Map<\/h3>\n <h3>Buttons<\/h3><a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 \">\n Default button\n<\/a>\n<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 fw-btn-white\">\n White button\n<\/a>\n<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 fw-btn-yellow\">\n Yellow button\n<\/a>\n <h3>Map<\/h3>\n <a href=\"#fw-tabs-5a719f7dbca1a-1\">Tab 1<\/a>\n <a href=\"#fw-tabs-5a719f7dbca1a-2\">Tab 2<\/a>\n <p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\/p>\n <p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \"bitcoin.org\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\/p>\n <h3>Table<\/h3>\n Table header 1 \n Table header 2 \n Table header 3 \n Table row 1 \n Data \n Data \n Data \n Table row 2 \n Data \n Data \n Data \n Table row 3 \n Data \n Data \n Data \n <h3>Notification<\/h3>\n \u041f\u043e\u0437\u0434\u0440\u0430\u0432\u043b\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0435! Congratulations\n \u0418\u043d\u0444\u043e\u0440\u043c\u0430\u0446\u0438\u044f! Information\n \u041f\u0440\u0435\u0434\u0443\u043f\u0440\u0435\u0436\u0434\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0435! Warning\n \u041e\u0448\u0438\u0431\u043a\u0430! Error\n <h3>Icons<\/h3>\n <h3>Block with icon<\/h3>\n <p>Block description.<\/p>\n<h4>Simple icons<\/h4>\n <h3>Contact<\/h3>\n \u0422\u0435\u043a\u0441\u0442 \u043e\u0434\u0438\u043d\u043e\u0447\u043d\u043e\u0439 \u0441\u0442\u0440\u043e\u043a\u0438 * \n \u0422\u0435\u043a\u0441\u0442 \u043e\u0434\u0438\u043d\u043e\u0447\u043d\u043e\u0439 \u0441\u0442\u0440\u043e\u043a\u0438 * \n \u042d\u043b\u0435\u043a\u0442\u0440\u043e\u043d\u043d\u044b\u0439 \u0430\u0434\u0440\u0435\u0441 * \n \u0415\u0434\u0438\u043d\u0441\u0442\u0432\u0435\u043d\u043d\u044b\u0439 \u0432\u0430\u0440\u0438\u0430\u043d\u0442 * \n Checkbox 1\n Checkbox 2\n Checkbox 3\n \u041d\u0435\u0441\u043a\u043e\u043b\u044c\u043a\u043e \u0432\u0430\u0440\u0438\u0430\u043d\u0442\u043e\u0432 * \n Radio 1\n Radio 2\n Radio 3\n \u0412\u044b\u043f\u0430\u0434\u0430\u044e\u0449\u0438\u0439 \u0441\u043f\u0438\u0441\u043e\u043a * \n Value 1\n Value 2\n Value 3\n \u0422\u0435\u043a\u0441\u0442 \u0441\u043e\u043e\u0431\u0449\u0435\u043d\u0438\u044f *\n\n<!-- 919e754c2abf278865fc8e0625dd8fad -->","post_title":"Elements","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"144-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2018-01-31 13:50:37","post_modified_gmt":"2018-01-31 10:50:37","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"144","guid":"http:\/\/unyson\/2018\/01\/31\/144-revision-v1\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"revision","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"168","post_author":"1","post_date":"2018-01-31 14:53:54","post_date_gmt":"2018-01-31 11:53:54","post_content":"<h3>Image<\/h3><img src=\"\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/image-1.png\" alt=\"\/\/unyson\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/image-1.png\" \/>\n <h3>Video<\/h3>\n <h3>Accordion<\/h3><p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n <h3 class=\"fw-accordion-title\">Tab 1<\/h3>\n <p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\/p>\n <h3 class=\"fw-accordion-title\">Tab 2<\/h3>\n <p>Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. They can be exchanged for other currencies, products, and services. As of February 2015, over 100,000 merchants and vendors accepted bitcoin as payment. Research produced by the University of Cambridge estimates that in 2017, there are 2.9 to 5.8 million unique users using a cryptocurrency wallet, most of them using bitcoin.<\/p>\n <h3>Calendar<\/h3>\n \u0421\u0435\u0433\u043e\u0434\u043d\u044f\n <h3><\/h3>\n <h3>Map<\/h3>\n <h3>Buttons<\/h3><a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 \">\n Default button\n<\/a>\n<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 fw-btn-white\">\n White button\n<\/a>\n<a href=\"#\" target=\"_self\" class=\"fw-btn fw-btn-1 fw-btn-yellow\">\n Yellow button\n<\/a>\n <h3>Map<\/h3>\n <a href=\"#fw-tabs-5a71ae52b445b-1\">Tab 1<\/a>\n <a href=\"#fw-tabs-5a71ae52b445b-2\">Tab 2<\/a>\n <p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\/p>\n <p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \"bitcoin.org\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\/p>\n <h3>Table<\/h3>\n Table header 1 \n Table header 2 \n Table header 3 \n Table row 1 \n Data \n Data \n Data \n Table row 2 \n Data \n Data \n Data \n Table row 3 \n Data \n Data \n Data \n <h3>Notification<\/h3>\n \u041f\u043e\u0437\u0434\u0440\u0430\u0432\u043b\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0435! Congratulations\n \u0418\u043d\u0444\u043e\u0440\u043c\u0430\u0446\u0438\u044f! Information\n \u041f\u0440\u0435\u0434\u0443\u043f\u0440\u0435\u0436\u0434\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0435! Warning\n \u041e\u0448\u0438\u0431\u043a\u0430! Error\n <h3>Icons<\/h3>\n <h3>Block with icon<\/h3>\n <p>Block description.<\/p>\n<h4>Simple icons<\/h4>\n <h3>Contact<\/h3>\n First Name * \n Last name * \n Email * \n Radio buttons * \n Radio 1\n Radio 2\n Radio 3\n Checkboxes * \n Checkbox 1\n Checkbox 2\n Checkbox 3\n Message *\n\n<!-- 3fb41a16dc27c267c7b118b31a72734c -->","post_title":"Elements","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"144-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2018-01-31 14:53:54","post_modified_gmt":"2018-01-31 11:53:54","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"144","guid":"http:\/\/unyson\/2018\/01\/31\/144-revision-v1\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"revision","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}
{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"169","post_author":"1","post_date":"2018-01-31 17:06:43","post_date_gmt":"2018-01-31 14:06:43","post_content":"<h1>Heading 1<\/h1><p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\/p><h2>Heading 2<\/h2><p>Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. They can be exchanged for other currencies, products, and services. As of February 2015, over 100,000 merchants and vendors accepted bitcoin as payment. Research produced by the University of Cambridge estimates that in 2017, there are 2.9 to 5.8 million unique users using a cryptocurrency wallet, most of them using bitcoin.<\/p><h3>Heading 3<\/h3><p>The word bitcoin first occurred and was defined in the white paper that was published on 31 October 2008. It is a compound of the words bit and coin. The white paper frequently uses the shorter coin. There is no uniform convention for bitcoin capitalization. Some sources use Bitcoin, capitalized, to refer to the technology and network and bitcoin, lowercase, to refer to the unit of account. The Wall Street Journal, The Chronicle of Higher Education, and the Oxford English Dictionary advocate use of lowercase bitcoin in all cases, a convention followed throughout this article.<\/p><h4>Heading 4<\/h4><p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\/p><h5>Heading 5<\/h5><p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \"bitcoin.org\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\/p><h6>Heading 6<\/h6><p>In January 2009, the bitcoin network came into existence after Satoshi Nakamoto mined the first ever block on the chain, known as the genesis block. Embedded in the coinbase of this block was the following text:<\/p><h2>Unordered Lists<\/h2>List item oneList item oneList item oneList item twoList item threeList item fourList item twoList item threeList item fourList item twoList item threeList item four<h3>Ordered List<\/h3>List item one -start at 8List item oneList item one -reversed attributeList item twoList item threeList item fourList item twoList item threeList item fourList item twoList item threeList item four\n\n<!-- 1064b304be637adb9f2d5835aa0f9687 -->","post_title":"Typography","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"139-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2018-01-31 17:06:43","post_modified_gmt":"2018-01-31 14:06:43","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"139","guid":"http:\/\/unyson\/2018\/01\/31\/139-revision-v1\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"revision","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}
{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"170","post_author":"1","post_date":"2018-01-31 17:08:23","post_date_gmt":"2018-01-31 14:08:23","post_content":"<h1>Heading 1<\/h1><p>Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency and worldwide payment system. It is the first decentralized digital currency, as the system works without a central bank or single administrator. The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\/p><h2>Heading 2<\/h2><p>Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. They can be exchanged for other currencies, products, and services. As of February 2015, over 100,000 merchants and vendors accepted bitcoin as payment. Research produced by the University of Cambridge estimates that in 2017, there are 2.9 to 5.8 million unique users using a cryptocurrency wallet, most of them using bitcoin.<\/p><h3>Heading 3<\/h3><p>The word bitcoin first occurred and was defined in the white paper that was published on 31 October 2008. It is a compound of the words bit and coin. The white paper frequently uses the shorter coin. There is no uniform convention for bitcoin capitalization. Some sources use Bitcoin, capitalized, to refer to the technology and network and bitcoin, lowercase, to refer to the unit of account. The Wall Street Journal, The Chronicle of Higher Education, and the Oxford English Dictionary advocate use of lowercase bitcoin in all cases, a convention followed throughout this article.<\/p><h4>Heading 4<\/h4><p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\/p><h5>Heading 5<\/h5><p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \"bitcoin.org\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\/p><h6>Heading 6<\/h6><p>In January 2009, the bitcoin network came into existence after Satoshi Nakamoto mined the first ever block on the chain, known as the genesis block. Embedded in the coinbase of this block was the following text:<\/p><h2>Unordered Lists<\/h2>List item oneList item oneList item oneList item twoList item threeList item fourList item twoList item threeList item fourList item twoList item threeList item four<h3>Ordered List<\/h3>List item one -start at 8List item oneList item one -reversed attributeList item twoList item threeList item fourList item twoList item threeList item fourList item twoList item threeList item four\n\n<!-- b9df1914672bced20878510a96adab82 -->","post_title":"Typography","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"139-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2018-01-31 17:08:23","post_modified_gmt":"2018-01-31 14:08:23","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"139","guid":"http:\/\/unyson\/2018\/01\/31\/139-revision-v1\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"revision","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}

The network is peer-to-peer and transactions take place between users directly, without an intermediary. These transactions are verified by network nodes through the use of cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain. Bitcoin was invented by an unknown person or group of people under the name Satoshi Nakamoto and released as open-source software in 2009.<\/p><h2>Heading 2<\/h2><p>Bitcoins are created as a reward for a process known as mining. They can be exchanged for other currencies, products, and services. As of February 2015, over 100,000 merchants and vendors accepted bitcoin as payment. Research produced by the University of Cambridge estimates that in 2017, there are 2.9 to 5.8 million unique users using a cryptocurrency wallet, most of them using bitcoin.<\/p><h3>Heading 3<\/h3><p>The word bitcoin first occurred and was defined in the white paper that was published on 31 October 2008. It is a compound of the words bit and coin. The white paper frequently uses the shorter coin. There is no uniform convention for bitcoin capitalization. Some sources use Bitcoin, capitalized, to refer to the technology and network and bitcoin, lowercase, to refer to the unit of account. The Wall Street Journal, The Chronicle of Higher Education, and the Oxford English Dictionary advocate use of lowercase bitcoin in all cases, a convention followed throughout this article.<\/p><h4>Heading 4<\/h4><p>The unit of account of the bitcoin system is bitcoin. Ticker symbols used to represent bitcoin are BTC and XBT. Its Unicode character is \u20bf. Small amounts of bitcoin used as alternative units are millibitcoin (mBTC), bit and satoshi (sat). Named in homage to bitcoin's creator, a satoshi is the smallest amount within bitcoin representing 0.00000001 bitcoins, one hundred millionth of a bitcoin. A bit equals 0.000001 bitcoins, one millionth of a bitcoin or 100 satoshis. A millibitcoin equals 0.001 bitcoins, one thousandth of a bitcoin or 100,000 satoshis.<\/p><h5>Heading 5<\/h5><p>On 18 August 2008, the domain name \"bitcoin.org\" was registered. In November that year, a link to a paper authored by Satoshi Nakamoto titled Bitcoin: A Peer-to-Peer Electronic Cash System was posted to a cryptography mailing list. Nakamoto implemented the bitcoin software as open source code and released it in January 2009 on SourceForge. The identity of Nakamoto remains unknown.<\/p><h6>Heading 6<\/h6><p>In January 2009, the bitcoin network came into existence after Satoshi Nakamoto mined the first ever block on the chain, known as the genesis block. -->","post_title":"Homepage","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"5-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2018-02-05
